  math: [
    { id: "2001", front: "What is a linear combination of vectors $v_1, v_2, \dots, v_k$?", back: "A sum of the form $c_1v_1 + c_2v_2 + \dots + c_kv_k$, where $c_i$ are scalars.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2002", front: "What is the rank-nullity theorem for a linear transformation $T: V \to W$?", back: "$\\dim(\\text{Ker}(T)) + \\dim(\\text{Im}(T)) = \\dim(V)$ (Nullity + Rank = Dimension of Domain)", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2003", front: "What is the condition for a set of vectors to be linearly independent?", back: "The only solution to $c_1v_1 + c_2v_2 + \dots + c_kv_k = 0$ is the trivial solution $c_1=c_2=\dots=c_k=0$.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2004", front: "What is the algebraic structure that is an Abelian group with a second associative, distributive binary operation, but no requirement for a multiplicative inverse?", back: "Ring (specifically, a Commutative Ring with Unity is often what's implied)", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2005", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of a function $f(x)$ centered at $a$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} \\frac{f^{(n)}(a)}{n!}(x-a)^n$", subject: "Calculus/Series" },
    { id: "2006", front: "What is the name of the differential equation $\\frac{dy}{dx} = f(x)g(y)$?", back: "Separable Equation", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2007", front: "What is the formula for the magnitude (or norm) of a vector $\mathbf{v} = \langle x, y, z \rangle$?", back: "$||\\mathbf{v}|| = \\sqrt{x^2 + y^2 + z^2}$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2008", front: "What is the Cauchy-Riemann equation for an analytic function $f(z) = u(x, y) + iv(x, y)$?", back: "$\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial x} = \\frac{\\partial v}{\partial y}$ and $\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial y} = -\\frac{\\partial v}{\\partial x}$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2009", front: "What is the identity element in the group of $n \times n$ invertible matrices under matrix multiplication?", back: "The Identity Matrix ($I_n$)", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2010", front: "What does the Intermediate Value Theorem state for a continuous function $f$ on $[a, b]$?", back: "If $k$ is any value between $f(a)$ and $f(b)$, then there exists a $c$ in $(a, b)$ such that $f(c) = k$.", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2011", front: "What is the formula for the eigenvalues $\lambda$ of a matrix $A$?", back: "The roots of the characteristic equation $\\det(A - \\lambda I) = 0$.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2012", front: "What is the product rule for differentiation in multivariable calculus (i.e., the derivative of $\mathbf{u}(t) \cdot \mathbf{v}(t)$)?", back: "$\\frac{d}{dt} [\\mathbf{u}(t) \\cdot \\mathbf{v}(t)] = \\mathbf{u}'(t) \\cdot \\mathbf{v}(t) + \\mathbf{u}(t) \\cdot \\mathbf{v}'(t)$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2013", front: "What is the definition of a subgroup $H$ of a group $G$?", back: "A subset $H$ that is itself a group under the same operation as $G$ (often checked by the one-step subgroup test).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2014", front: "What does the p-series test state about the convergence of $\\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} \\frac{1}{n^p}$?", back: "It converges if $p > 1$ and diverges if $p \le 1$.", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2015", front: "What is a basis for a vector space $V$?", back: "A set of vectors that is both linearly independent and spans $V$.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2016", front: "What is the order of an element $g$ in a group $G$?", back: "The smallest positive integer $n$ such that $g^n = e$ (the identity element). If no such integer exists, the order is infinite.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2017", front: "What is the formula for the arc length of a curve $y = f(x)$ from $x=a$ to $x=b$?", back: "$L = \\int_a^b \\sqrt{1 + \\left(\\frac{dy}{dx}\\right)^2} \,dx$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2018", front: "What is the definition of a compact set in $\mathbb{R}^n$?", back: "A set that is both closed and bounded (Heine-Borel Theorem).", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2019", front: "What is the formula for the characteristic polynomial of a matrix $A$?", back: "$p(\\lambda) = \\det(A - \\lambda I)$", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2020", front: "What is the property that a matrix $A$ is equal to its own transpose, $A = A^T$?", back: "Symmetric matrix", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2021", front: "What is Green's Theorem (in the plane, vector form)?", back: "$\\oint_C \\mathbf{F} \\cdot d\\mathbf{r} = \\iint_D (\\frac{\\partial Q}{\\partial x} - \\frac{\\partial P}{\\partial y}) \,dA$, where $\\mathbf{F} = \langle P, Q \rangle$.", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2022", front: "What is the kernel (or null space) of a linear transformation $T: V \to W$?", back: "The set of vectors in the domain $V$ that map to the zero vector in $W$, i.e., $\{\\mathbf{v} \in V \\mid T(\\mathbf{v}) = \\mathbf{0}\}$.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2023", front: "What is the definition of a Cauchy sequence?", back: "A sequence $\{x_n\}$ such that for every $\epsilon > 0$, there exists an integer $N$ such that for all $m, n > N$, $|x_n - x_m| < \epsilon$.", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2024", front: "What does the Lagrange's Theorem state in group theory?", back: "If $H$ is a subgroup of a finite group $G$, then the order of $H$ divides the order of $G$ ($|H|$ divides $|G|$).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2025", front: "What is the general form of a second-order homogeneous linear ODE with constant coefficients?", back: "$ay'' + by' + cy = 0$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2026", front: "What is the formula for integration by parts?", back: "$\\int u \,dv = uv - \\int v \,du$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2027", front: "What is the formula for the surface area of revolution of a curve $y=f(x)$ about the $x$-axis from $x=a$ to $x=b$?", back: "$SA = \\int_a^b 2\\pi f(x) \\sqrt{1 + (f'(x))^2} \,dx$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2028", front: "What is the definition of an inner product on a vector space $V$?", back: "A function $\langle \cdot, \cdot \rangle: V \times V \to \mathbb{R}$ (or $\mathbb{C}$) that is linear in the first argument, conjugate symmetric, and positive definite.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2029", front: "What is the value of Euler's totient function $\phi(n)$ for a prime number $p$?", back: "$\\phi(p) = p - 1$", subject: "Number Theory/Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2030", front: "What is the definition of continuity of a function $f(x)$ at a point $c$?", back: "$\\lim_{x \\to c} f(x) = f(c)$", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2031", front: "What is the term for a square matrix that is not invertible?", back: "Singular (or non-invertible) matrix", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2032", front: "What is the formula for the Jacobian determinant of a change of variables $x=g(u, v)$, $y=h(u, v)$?", back: "$J = \\frac{\\partial(x, y)}{\\partial(u, v)} = \\det \\begin{pmatrix} \\frac{\\partial x}{\\partial u} & \\frac{\\partial x}{\\partial v} \\\\ \\frac{\\partial y}{\\partial u} & \\frac{\\partial y}{\\partial v} \\end{pmatrix} = \\frac{\\partial x}{\\partial u} \\frac{\\partial y}{\\partial v} - \\frac{\\partial x}{\\partial v} \\frac{\\partial y}{\\partial u}$", subject: "Multivariable Calculus" },
    { id: "2033", front: "What is the formula for the radius of convergence $R$ of a power series $\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} c_n (x-a)^n$ using the ratio test?", back: "$R = \\frac{1}{L}$, where $L = \\lim_{n \\to \\infty} \\left| \\frac{c_{n+1}}{c_n} \\right|$ (or $R = \\infty$ if $L=0$, and $R=0$ if $L=\infty$)", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2034", front: "What is the formula for the Wronskian of two solutions $y_1, y_2$ to a second-order linear ODE?", back: "$W(y_1, y_2) = \\det \\begin{pmatrix} y_1 & y_2 \\\\ y_1' & y_2' \\end{pmatrix} = y_1y_2' - y_2y_1'$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2035", front: "What is a cyclic group?", back: "A group $G$ that can be generated by a single element $a$, i.e., $G = \\langle a \\rangle = \{a^k \\mid k \in \mathbb{Z}\}$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2036", front: "What is the name of the algebraic concept that is both a Ring and a Field?", back: "A Field is a commutative ring with unity where every non-zero element has a multiplicative inverse.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2037", front: "What is the Divergence Theorem (or Gauss's Theorem)?", back: "$\\iiint_E \\text{div} \\mathbf{F} \,dV = \\iint_{\\partial E} \\mathbf{F} \\cdot \\mathbf{n} \,dS$, relating a volume integral to a surface integral.", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2038", front: "What is the term for a vector $\mathbf{v}$ such that $A\mathbf{v} = \lambda\mathbf{v}$ for a matrix $A$ and a scalar $\lambda$?", back: "Eigenvector", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2039", front: "What is the definition of a measurable set (in the context of Lebesgue measure)?", back: "A set $E$ for which the Lebesgue measure $\mu$ satisfies $\mu(A) = \mu(A \\cap E) + \mu(A \\cap E^c)$ for all subsets $A$ of $\mathbb{R}^n$.", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2040", front: "What is the product rule for two permutations $\sigma$ and $\tau$?", back: "The composition of the functions, $\sigma \tau$ (often read right-to-left: apply $\tau$ first, then $\sigma$).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2041", front: "What is the Laplace Transform of $f(t)$?", back: "$F(s) = \\mathcal{L}\\{f(t)\\} = \\int_0^{\\infty} e^{-st} f(t) \,dt$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2042", front: "What is the formula for the cross product of $\mathbf{a} = \langle a_1, a_2, a_3 \rangle$ and $\mathbf{b} = \langle b_1, b_2, b_3 \rangle$?", back: "$\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} = \\langle a_2b_3 - a_3b_2, a_3b_1 - a_1b_3, a_1b_2 - a_2b_1 \rangle$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2043", front: "What is the conjugate of a complex number $z = a + bi$?", back: "$\\bar{z} = a - bi$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2044", front: "What is the dimension of the vector space $P_n$ of all polynomials of degree at most $n$?", back: "$n+1$", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2045", front: "What is the name for the equation $\mathbf{v}'(t) = A\mathbf{v}(t)$, where $A$ is a matrix?", back: "A system of first-order linear differential equations (or a linear system of ODEs).", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2046", front: "What is the result of the dot product of two orthogonal vectors $\mathbf{u}$ and $\mathbf{v}$?", back: "$\\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{v} = 0$", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2047", front: "What does the Weierstrass M-Test determine for a sequence of functions $\{f_n\}$?", back: "It determines uniform convergence of the series $\\sum f_n(x)$.", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2048", front: "What is the Cayley's Theorem in group theory?", back: "Every group is isomorphic to a subgroup of a permutation group (or symmetric group $S_n$).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2049", front: "What is the Laplacian of a scalar function $f(x, y, z)$?", back: "$\\nabla^2 f = \\nabla \\cdot (\\nabla f) = \\frac{\\partial^2 f}{\\partial x^2} + \\frac{\\partial^2 f}{\\partial y^2} + \\frac{\\partial^2 f}{\\partial z^2}$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2050", front: "What does Euler's Formula state, relating $e$, $i$, and trigonometric functions?", back: "$e^{i\theta} = \\cos(\\theta) + i \\sin(\\theta)$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2051", front: "What is the formula for the volume of a solid defined by revolving the region under $y=f(x)$ from $a$ to $b$ around the $x$-axis (Disk Method)?", back: "$V = \\int_a^b \\pi [f(x)]^2 \,dx$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2052", front: "What is the complex number $i^i$ (i to the power of i)?", back: "$e^{-\pi/2}$ (or generally $e^{-(\frac{\pi}{2} + 2k\pi)}$ for integer $k$)", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2053", front: "What is a coset of a subgroup $H$ in a group $G$?", back: "A left coset is a set of the form $aH = \{ah \mid h \in H\}$, and a right coset is $Ha = \{ha \mid h \in H\}$, for $a \in G$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2054", front: "What is the general solution to the homogeneous ODE $y'' + \omega^2 y = 0$?", back: "$y(x) = c_1 \cos(\omega x) + c_2 \sin(\omega x)$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2055", front: "What is the Schwarz inequality for vectors in an inner product space?", back: "$|\langle u, v \rangle| \le ||u|| \cdot ||v||$", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2056", front: "What is a topological space $(X, \mathcal{T})$?", back: "A set $X$ with a collection $\mathcal{T}$ of subsets of $X$ (the open sets) that includes $\emptyset$ and $X$, is closed under arbitrary union, and closed under finite intersection.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2057", front: "State the Residue Theorem (for complex integration).", back: "$\\oint_C f(z) \,dz = 2\\pi i \\sum \\text{Residues}$ (where the sum is over residues of $f$ inside the simple closed curve $C$).", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2058", front: "What is the definition of a homomorphism $\phi: G \to H$ between two groups?", back: "A map such that $\phi(a \cdot_G b) = \phi(a) \cdot_H \phi(b)$ for all $a, b \in G$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2059", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{a^2 + x^2}$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{a} \\arctan(\\frac{x}{a}) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2060", front: "What is the condition for a solution to an ODE to be stable at an equilibrium point?", back: "If all solutions that start near the equilibrium point stay near it (Lyapunov stability).", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2061", front: "What is the range (or column space) of a matrix $A$?", back: "The set of all vectors $\mathbf{b}$ such that $A\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}$ has a solution (i.e., the span of the columns of $A$).", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2062", front: "What does it mean for a topological space to be connected?", back: "It cannot be written as the union of two disjoint, non-empty open sets.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2063", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $f(x) = \sin(x)$ centered at $x=0$ (Maclaurin series)?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} (-1)^n \\frac{x^{2n+1}}{(2n+1)!} = x - \\frac{x^3}{3!} + \\frac{x^5}{5!} - \\dots$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2064", front: "What is the name of the algebraic structure where every non-zero element has a multiplicative inverse?", back: "Division Ring (or Skew Field); if multiplication is also commutative, it's a Field.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2065", front: "What is the Fourier series formula for a $2\\pi$-periodic function $f(x)$?", back: "$f(x) = \\frac{a_0}{2} + \\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} [a_n \cos(nx) + b_n \sin(nx)]$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2066", front: "What is the Cauchy integral formula?", back: "$\\oint_C \\frac{f(z)}{z-a} \,dz = 2\\pi i f(a)$ (where $a$ is inside the simple closed curve $C$ and $f$ is analytic on and inside $C$).", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2067", front: "What is the definition of a normal subgroup $N$ of a group $G$?", back: "A subgroup such that $gN = Ng$ for all $g \in G$ (or $gng^{-1} \in N$ for all $g \in G, n \in N$).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2068", front: "What is the condition for two matrices $A$ and $B$ to be similar?", back: "There exists an invertible matrix $P$ such that $B = P^{-1}AP$.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2069", front: "What is the general solution to the homogeneous ODE $y'' - \omega^2 y = 0$?", back: "$y(x) = c_1 e^{\omega x} + c_2 e^{-\omega x}$ (or $c_1 \cosh(\omega x) + c_2 \sinh(\omega x)$)", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2070", front: "What is the formula for the surface integral of a scalar function $f(x, y, z)$ over a surface $S$ parameterized by $\mathbf{r}(u, v)$?", back: "$\\iint_S f(x, y, z) \,dS = \\iint_D f(\mathbf{r}(u, v)) ||\\mathbf{r}_u \times \\mathbf{r}_v|| \,dA$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2071", front: "What is the integral of $\\sec(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\sec(x) + \\tan(x)| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2072", front: "What is the definition of a Hausdorff space (or $T_2$ space)?", back: "For any two distinct points $x, y$ in the space, there exist disjoint open sets $U$ and $V$ such that $x \in U$ and $y \in V$.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2073", front: "What is the complex form of the Fourier series for a $2\\pi$-periodic function $f(x)$?", back: "$f(x) = \\sum_{n=-\\infty}^{\\infty} c_n e^{inx}$, where $c_n = \\frac{1}{2\\pi} \\int_{-\\pi}^{\\pi} f(x) e^{-inx} \,dx$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2074", front: "What is the kernel of a ring homomorphism $\phi: R \to S$?", back: "The set of elements in $R$ that map to the zero element in $S$, i.e., $\\text{Ker}(\phi) = \{r \in R \\mid \phi(r) = 0_S\}$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2075", front: "What is the formula for Stoke's Theorem?", back: "$\\oint_{\\partial S} \\mathbf{F} \\cdot d\\mathbf{r} = \\iint_S (\\text{curl} \\mathbf{F}) \\cdot \\mathbf{n} \,dS$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2076", front: "What is the Taylor series of $f(x) = e^x$ centered at $a$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} \\frac{e^a}{n!}(x-a)^n$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2077", front: "What is a singular point of an ODE $\\frac{dy}{dx} = f(x, y)$?", back: "A point $(x_0, y_0)$ where $f(x, y)$ or $\\frac{\\partial f}{\\partial y}$ is not continuous, meaning the existence/uniqueness theorem may not hold.", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2078", front: "What is the condition for an $n \times n$ matrix $A$ to be diagonalizable?", back: "It must have $n$ linearly independent eigenvectors.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2079", front: "What is the definition of a field in abstract algebra?", back: "A commutative ring with unity where every non-zero element has a multiplicative inverse.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2080", front: "What is the Complex Conjugate Root Theorem for polynomials with real coefficients?", back: "If a complex number $z$ is a root, then its conjugate $\\bar{z}$ is also a root.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2081", front: "What is the integral of $\\csc(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\csc(x) - \\cot(x)| + C$ (or $-\\ln|\\csc(x) + \\cot(x)| + C$)", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2082", front: "What is the definition of a basis for a topology?", back: "A collection $\mathcal{B}$ of open sets such that every open set in $\mathcal{T}$ can be written as a union of elements of $\mathcal{B}$.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2083", front: "What is the formula for the volume of a solid defined by revolving the region under $y=f(x)$ from $a$ to $b$ around the $y$-axis (Cylindrical Shells)?", back: "$V = \\int_a^b 2\\pi x f(x) \,dx$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2084", front: "What is the image of the function $f(z) = e^z$ in the complex plane?", back: "The entire complex plane excluding the origin: $\mathbb{C} \setminus \{0\}$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2085", front: "What is a principal ideal $I$ in a ring $R$?", back: "An ideal generated by a single element $a \in R$, written as $\\langle a \\rangle = \{ra \\mid r \in R\}$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2086", front: "What is the general solution to the Euler-Cauchy ODE $ax^2y'' + bxy' + cy = 0$ (for distinct real roots $r_1, r_2$)?", back: "$y(x) = c_1 x^{r_1} + c_2 x^{r_2}$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2087", front: "What is the Fundamental Theorem of Algebra?", back: "Every non-constant single-variable polynomial with complex coefficients has at least one complex root.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2088", front: "What is the Gram-Schmidt process used for?", back: "To transform a basis for an inner product space into an orthogonal or orthonormal basis.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2089", front: "What is the definition of an isomorphism $\phi: G \to H$ between two groups?", back: "A bijective homomorphism (a one-to-one and onto homomorphism).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2090", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $f(x) = \ln(1+x)$ centered at $x=0$ (Maclaurin series)?", back: "$\\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} (-1)^{n+1} \\frac{x^n}{n} = x - \\frac{x^2}{2} + \\frac{x^3}{3} - \\dots$ (valid for $|x| < 1$)", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2091", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{\\sqrt{a^2 - x^2}}$?", back: "$\\arcsin(\\frac{x}{a}) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2092", front: "What is a subspace of a vector space $V$?", back: "A subset $W$ of $V$ that is itself a vector space under the operations of $V$ (closed under addition and scalar multiplication).", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2093", front: "What is a quotient group $G/N$ (where $N$ is a normal subgroup of $G$)?", back: "The group whose elements are the cosets of $N$, with the operation defined by $(aN)(bN) = (ab)N$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2094", front: "What is the Cauchy-Hadamard formula for the radius of convergence $R$ of a power series?", back: "$\\frac{1}{R} = \\limsup_{n \\to \\infty} \\sqrt[n]{|c_n|}$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2095", front: "What is the name for the equation $\\mathbf{x}'(t) = A\mathbf{x}(t) + \mathbf{f}(t)$?", back: "A non-homogeneous linear system of differential equations.", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2096", front: "What is a closed set in a topological space?", back: "A set whose complement is an open set.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2097", front: "What is the formula for the integral test for series convergence?", back: "If $f(x)$ is positive, continuous, and decreasing for $x \ge N$, then $\\sum_{n=N}^{\\infty} a_n$ converges if and only if $\\int_N^{\\infty} f(x) \,dx$ converges.", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2098", front: "What is the definition of an integral domain?", back: "A commutative ring with unity that has no zero divisors (if $ab=0$, then $a=0$ or $b=0$).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2099", front: "What is the D'Alembert's ratio test for series convergence?", back: "The series $\\sum a_n$ converges absolutely if $\\lim_{n \\to \\infty} \\left| \\frac{a_{n+1}}{a_n} \\right| < 1$, and diverges if the limit is $> 1$.", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2100", front: "What is the formula for a change of basis matrix $P_{C \leftarrow B}$ from basis $B$ to basis $C$?", back: "The matrix whose columns are the $B$-basis vectors expressed in terms of the $C$-basis.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2101", front: "What is the Liouville's Theorem in Complex Analysis?", back: "A bounded entire function (analytic everywhere in $\\mathbb{C}$) must be a constant function.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2102", front: "What is a factor ring (or quotient ring) $R/I$ (where $I$ is an ideal of $R$)?", back: "The ring whose elements are the cosets of $I$, with addition $(a+I) + (b+I) = (a+b)+I$ and multiplication $(a+I)(b+I) = ab+I$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2103", front: "What is the formula for the Variation of Parameters for a second-order non-homogeneous ODE $y'' + P(x)y' + Q(x)y = f(x)$?", back: "$y_p = -y_1 \\int \\frac{y_2 f(x)}{W(y_1, y_2)} \,dx + y_2 \\int \\frac{y_1 f(x)}{W(y_1, y_2)} \,dx$, where $W$ is the Wronskian.", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2104", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{\\sqrt{x^2 + a^2}}$?", back: "$\\ln|x + \\sqrt{x^2 + a^2}| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2105", front: "What is the definition of a metric space $(X, d)$?", back: "A set $X$ with a distance function $d: X \times X \to [0, \infty)$ that is non-negative, symmetric, satisfies the triangle inequality, and $d(x, y)=0 \\iff x=y$.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2106", front: "What is the formula for the divergence of a vector field $\mathbf{F} = \langle P, Q, R \rangle$?", back: "$\\text{div} \\mathbf{F} = \\nabla \\cdot \\mathbf{F} = \\frac{\\partial P}{\\partial x} + \\frac{\\partial Q}{\\partial y} + \\frac{\\partial R}{\\partial z}$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2107", front: "What is the condition for a series $\\sum a_n$ to be conditionally convergent?", back: "The series $\\sum a_n$ converges, but the series of absolute values $\\sum |a_n|$ diverges.", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2108", front: "What is the First Isomorphism Theorem for Groups?", back: "If $\phi: G \to H$ is a group homomorphism, then $G / \\text{Ker}(\phi) \\cong \\text{Im}(\phi)$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2109", front: "What is the method for solving a first-order ODE of the form $\\frac{dy}{dx} = f(\\frac{y}{x})$?", back: "Homogeneous substitution: Let $v = y/x$, so $y = vx$ and $\\frac{dy}{dx} = v + x\\frac{dv}{dx}$.", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2110", front: "What is the spectral theorem for symmetric matrices?", back: "A real symmetric matrix $A$ is orthogonally diagonalizable (i.e., $A = PDP^T$ where $D$ is diagonal and $P$ is orthogonal).", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2111", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{x \\sqrt{x^2 - a^2}}$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{a} \\arcsec(|\\frac{x}{a}|) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2112", front: "What is the definition of a compact topological space?", back: "Every open cover of the space has a finite subcover.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2113", front: "What is a pole of order $m$ for a complex function $f(z)$?", back: "An isolated singularity $z_0$ such that $f(z) = \\frac{g(z)}{(z-z_0)^m}$ where $g(z)$ is analytic at $z_0$ and $g(z_0) \\neq 0$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2114", front: "What is a field extension $E/F$?", back: "A field $E$ that contains a subfield $F$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2115", front: "What is the general solution to the homogeneous ODE $y'' - 2\lambda y' + \lambda^2 y = 0$ (for a repeated real root $\lambda$)?", back: "$y(x) = c_1 e^{\lambda x} + c_2 x e^{\lambda x}$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2116", front: "What is the formula for the curl of a vector field $\mathbf{F} = \langle P, Q, R \rangle$?", back: "$\\text{curl} \\mathbf{F} = \\nabla \\times \\mathbf{F} = \\langle \\frac{\\partial R}{\\partial y} - \\frac{\\partial Q}{\\partial z}, \\frac{\\partial P}{\\partial z} - \\frac{\\partial R}{\\partial x}, \\frac{\\partial Q}{\\partial x} - \\frac{\\partial P}{\\partial y} \\rangle$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2117", front: "What is the root test for series convergence?", back: "The series $\\sum a_n$ converges absolutely if $\\lim_{n \\to \\infty} \\sqrt[n]{|a_n|} < 1$, and diverges if the limit is $> 1$.", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2118", front: "What is the definition of a prime ideal $P$ in a commutative ring $R$?", back: "An ideal such that $P \neq R$ and if $ab \in P$, then $a \in P$ or $b \in P$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2119", front: "What is the integral of $\\ln(x)$?", back: "$x \\ln(x) - x + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2120", front: "What is the Cayley-Hamilton Theorem in Linear Algebra?", back: "Every square matrix $A$ satisfies its own characteristic equation $p(A) = 0$.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2121", front: "What is the formula for the Laurent series expansion of a complex function $f(z)$ around a point $z_0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=-\\infty}^{\\infty} c_n (z-z_0)^n$, where the summation includes both positive and negative powers.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2122", front: "What is the degree of a field extension $[E:F]$?", back: "The dimension of $E$ as a vector space over $F$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2123", front: "What is the term for an ODE that can be written as $\\frac{\\partial M}{\\partial y} = \\frac{\\partial N}{\\partial x}$ for $M(x, y) \,dx + N(x, y) \,dy = 0$?", back: "Exact differential equation", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2124", front: "What is the formula for the moment of inertia $I_x$ of a planar lamina with density $\rho(x, y)$ about the $x$-axis?", back: "$I_x = \\iint_D y^2 \rho(x, y) \,dA$", subject: "Multivariable Calculus" },
    { id: "2125", front: "What is a continuous map $f: X \to Y$ between two topological spaces?", back: "A map such that the preimage of every open set in $Y$ is an open set in $X$.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2126", front: "What is the integral of $\\sec^3(x)$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{2} \\sec(x)\\tan(x) + \\frac{1}{2} \\ln|\\sec(x) + \\tan(x)| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2127", front: "What is the Cauchy's Theorem for groups?", back: "If $G$ is a finite group and $p$ is a prime dividing $|G|$, then $G$ contains an element of order $p$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2128", front: "What is the residue of $f(z)$ at an isolated singularity $z_0$?", back: "The coefficient $c_{-1}$ of the $\\frac{1}{z-z_0}$ term in the Laurent series expansion of $f(z)$ around $z_0$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2129", front: "What is the definition of a Hilbert space?", back: "A complete inner product space (completeness with respect to the norm induced by the inner product).", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2130", front: "What is the formula for the $n$-th coefficient $c_n$ of the Laurent series of $f(z)$ centered at $z_0$?", back: "$c_n = \\frac{1}{2\\pi i} \\oint_C \\frac{f(z)}{(z-z_0)^{n+1}} \,dz$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2131", front: "What is the concept that is equivalent to 'a compact set in a metric space'?", back: "A sequentially compact set (every sequence has a convergent subsequence).", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2132", front: "What is a PID (Principal Ideal Domain)?", back: "An integral domain in which every ideal is a principal ideal.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2133", front: "What is the formula for the convolution of two functions $f(t)$ and $g(t)$?", back: "$(f  g)(t) = \\int_0^t f(\\tau) g(t-\\tau) \,d\\tau$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2134", front: "What is the convolution theorem for Laplace Transforms?", back: "$\\mathcal{L}\\{(f  g)(t)\\} = F(s)G(s)$ (the transform of the convolution is the product of the transforms).", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2135", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{\\sqrt{x^2 - a^2}}$?", back: "$\\ln|x + \\sqrt{x^2 - a^2}| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2136", front: "What is the name for the equation $\\mathbf{A}\mathbf{x} = \lambda \\mathbf{x}$ in linear algebra?", back: "The eigenvalue equation.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2137", front: "What is the definition of a maximal ideal $M$ in a ring $R$?", back: "An ideal such that $M \\neq R$ and if $I$ is any ideal with $M \subseteq I \subseteq R$, then $I=M$ or $I=R$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2138", front: "What is the value of $\\Gamma(n)$ for a positive integer $n$ (Gamma Function)?", back: "$\\Gamma(n) = (n-1)!$", subject: "Special Functions" },
    { id: "2139", front: "What is the result of the $\\text{div}(\\text{curl} \mathbf{F})$ (Divergence of a Curl)?", back: "$0$ (for a vector field $\mathbf{F}$ with continuous second partial derivatives).", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2140", front: "What is the Uniform Boundedness Principle (or Banach-Steinhaus Theorem)?", back: "A set of continuous linear operators on a Banach space is pointwise bounded if and only if it is uniformly bounded in norm.", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2141", front: "What is a removable singularity of a complex function $f(z)$ at $z_0$?", back: "A singularity where $\\lim_{z \\to z_0} f(z)$ exists and is finite. The Laurent series has no principal part (no negative powers).", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2142", front: "What is the integral of $\\tan(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\sec(x)| + C$ (or $-\\ln|\\cos(x)| + C$)", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2143", front: "What is the relationship between a maximal ideal $M$ and its quotient ring $R/M$?", back: "$R/M$ is a Field.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2144", front: "What is the definition of the Frobenius norm of a matrix $A$?", back: "$||A||_F = \\sqrt{\\sum_{i=1}^m \\sum_{j=1}^n |a_{ij}|^2} = \\sqrt{\\text{tr}(A^T A)}$", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2145", front: "What is the general solution to the homogeneous ODE $y'' + 2\lambda y' + (\lambda^2 + \omega^2) y = 0$?", back: "$y(x) = e^{-\lambda x} (c_1 \\cos(\omega x) + c_2 \\sin(\omega x))$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2146", front: "What is the formula for the directional derivative of $f(x, y, z)$ in the direction of a vector $\mathbf{v}$?", back: "$D_{\mathbf{u}}f = \\nabla f \\cdot \\mathbf{u}$, where $\mathbf{u} = \\frac{\mathbf{v}}{||\mathbf{v}||}$ (the unit vector).", subject: "Multivariable Calculus" },
    { id: "2147", front: "What is the maximum number of independent eigenvectors an $n \times n$ matrix can have?", back: "$n$", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2148", front: "What is the First Sylow Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "If $|G| = p^n m$ where $p$ is a prime not dividing $m$, then $G$ has a subgroup of order $p^k$ for all $1 \le k \le n$ (specifically, a Sylow $p$-subgroup of order $p^n$).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2149", front: "What is the formula for the residue of a function $f(z)$ at a simple pole $z_0$?", back: "$\\text{Res}_{z=z_0} f(z) = \\lim_{z \\to z_0} (z-z_0) f(z)$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2150", front: "What is the definition of a separated space ($T_1$ space)?", back: "A topological space where for any two distinct points $x, y$, there is an open set containing $x$ but not $y$. (or, every singleton set $\{x\}$ is closed).", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2151", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\frac{1}{1-x}$ centered at $x=0$ (Geometric Series)?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} x^n = 1 + x + x^2 + x^3 + \dots$ (valid for $|x| < 1$)", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2152", front: "What is the definition of a metric $d(x, y)$?", back: "A function satisfying non-negativity, identity of indiscernibles, symmetry, and the triangle inequality.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2153", front: "What is the Jordan Curve Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "Every non-self-intersecting continuous loop (Jordan curve) in the plane divides the plane into an interior region and an exterior region.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2154", front: "What is a UFD (Unique Factorization Domain)?", back: "An integral domain where every non-zero, non-unit element can be written as a product of prime elements (irreducibles) uniquely up to order and associates.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2155", front: "What is the formula for the line integral of a scalar function $f$ over a curve $C$ parameterized by $\mathbf{r}(t)$?", back: "$\\int_C f \,ds = \\int_a^b f(\\mathbf{r}(t)) ||\\mathbf{r}'(t)|| \,dt$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2156", front: "What is the Lebesgue criterion for Riemann integrability?", back: "A bounded function $f$ on $[a, b]$ is Riemann integrable if and only if the set of its discontinuities has Lebesgue measure zero.", subject: "Measure Theory/Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2157", front: "What is the $\mathbf{z}$-transform of a sequence $x[n]$?", back: "$X(z) = \\sum_{n=-\\infty}^{\\infty} x[n] z^{-n}$", subject: "Discrete Mathematics/Analysis" },
    { id: "2158", front: "What is the general solution to the homogeneous linear system $\\mathbf{x}'(t) = A\mathbf{x}(t)$ when $A$ has distinct real eigenvalues $\lambda_1, \lambda_2, \dots$?", back: "$\\mathbf{x}(t) = c_1 e^{\lambda_1 t} \mathbf{v}_1 + c_2 e^{\lambda_2 t} \mathbf{v}_2 + \dots$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2159", front: "What is the adjoint $A^$ of a matrix $A$ (in the complex case)?", back: "The conjugate transpose of $A$, $A^ = \\bar{A}^T$. (Also known as the Hermitian conjugate).", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2160", front: "What is a simple pole for a complex function $f(z)$?", back: "A pole of order 1 (i.e., $f(z)$ has a $\\frac{c_{-1}}{z-z_0}$ term but no higher negative powers in its Laurent series).", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2161", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\frac{1}{1+x}$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} (-1)^n x^n = 1 - x + x^2 - x^3 + \dots$ (valid for $|x| < 1$)", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2162", front: "What does the Baire Category Theorem state (for complete metric spaces)?", back: "A complete metric space is not the countable union of nowhere dense sets (it is of the second category).", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2163", front: "What is the definition of the Image of a ring homomorphism $\phi: R \to S$?", back: "The set of elements in $S$ that are images of elements in $R$, i.e., $\\text{Im}(\phi) = \{\phi(r) \\mid r \in R\}$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2164", front: "What is the maximum principle for harmonic functions?", back: "If $u(x)$ is a non-constant harmonic function on a connected domain $D$, $u$ attains its maximum value on the boundary of $D$.", subject: "PDE/Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2165", front: "What is the formula for the Fourier Transform of $f(t)$?", back: "$\\mathcal{F}(\\omega) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} f(t) e^{-i\\omega t} \,dt$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2166", front: "What is the definition of an improper integral of type I ($\\int_a^{\\infty} f(x) \,dx$)?", back: "$\\lim_{b \\to \\infty} \\int_a^b f(x) \,dx$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2167", front: "What is the Cayley's Formula for the number of labeled trees on $n$ vertices?", back: "$n^{n-2}$", subject: "Combinatorics" },
    { id: "2168", front: "What is the definition of a bounded set in a metric space $(X, d)$?", back: "A set $A \subseteq X$ such that there exists $x_0 \in X$ and $M > 0$ such that $d(x, x_0) < M$ for all $x \in A$.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2169", front: "What is the general solution to the homogeneous ODE $y''' - \lambda^3 y = 0$ (with one real root $\lambda$ and complex conjugate pair)?", back: "$y(x) = c_1 e^{\lambda x} + e^{-\frac{\lambda x}{2}} \\left(c_2 \\cos(\\frac{\\sqrt{3}}{2}\\lambda x) + c_3 \\sin(\\frac{\\sqrt{3}}{2}\\lambda x)\\right)$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2170", front: "What is the Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) of an $m \times n$ matrix $A$?", back: "$A = U \\Sigma V^T$, where $U$ and $V$ are orthogonal matrices and $\\Sigma$ is a diagonal matrix containing the singular values.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2171", front: "What is the integral of $\\cot(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\sin(x)| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2172", front: "What is the Poincaré Conjecture (now a theorem, informal statement)?", back: "Every simply connected, closed 3-manifold is topologically equivalent to the 3-sphere.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2173", front: "What is the result of the $\\text{curl}(\\nabla f)$ (Curl of a Gradient)?", back: "The zero vector $\mathbf{0}$ (for a scalar function $f$ with continuous second partials).", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2174", front: "What is the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus for Line Integrals?", back: "$\\int_C \\nabla f \\cdot d\\mathbf{r} = f(\mathbf{r}(b)) - f(\mathbf{r}(a))$ (where $\mathbf{r}(a)$ and $\mathbf{r}(b)$ are the endpoints of $C$).", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2175", front: "What is the Bessel's Inequality for Fourier series?", back: "$\\frac{1}{\\pi} \\int_{-\\pi}^{\\pi} [f(x)]^2 \,dx \\ge \\frac{a_0^2}{2} + \\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} (a_n^2 + b_n^2)$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2176", front: "What is the relationship between the norm and the inner product?", back: "$||v|| = \\sqrt{\langle v, v \rangle}$", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2177", front: "What is the definition of an ideal $I$ in a ring $R$?", back: "A non-empty subset $I$ that is a subgroup under addition, and is closed under multiplication by any element of $R$ (i.e., $rI \subseteq I$ and $Ir \subseteq I$).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2178", front: "What is the integral of $\\arcsin(x)$?", back: "$x \\arcsin(x) + \\sqrt{1 - x^2} + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2179", front: "What is the formula for the $n$-th coefficient $a_n$ of a Fourier Cosine Series on $[0, L]$?", back: "$a_n = \\frac{2}{L} \\int_0^L f(x) \\cos(\\frac{n\\pi x}{L}) \,dx$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2180", front: "What is the term for an ODE that includes partial derivatives, such as $\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = c^2 \\frac{\\partial^2 u}{\\partial x^2}$?", back: "Partial Differential Equation (PDE)", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2181", front: "What is the property that a matrix $U$ is equal to the inverse of its adjoint, $U^ = U^{-1}$?", back: "Unitary matrix (or Orthogonal if $U$ is real)", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2182", front: "What is the set $\mathbb{Q}(\\sqrt{2})$ in field theory?", back: "The smallest field extension of $\mathbb{Q}$ (rationals) that contains $\\sqrt{2}$, consisting of all numbers $a + b\\sqrt{2}$ where $a, b \\in \\mathbb{Q}$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2183", front: "What does the Picard-Lindelöf Theorem (or Existence and Uniqueness Theorem) guarantee for a first-order ODE $y' = f(t, y)$?", back: "Existence and Uniqueness of a solution in an interval around $t_0$, provided $f$ and $\\frac{\\partial f}{\\partial y}$ are continuous near $(t_0, y_0)$.", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2184", front: "What is the definition of the Lebesgue measure $\mu$ of an open interval $(a, b)$?", back: "$\\mu((a, b)) = b - a$", subject: "Measure Theory" },
    { id: "2185", front: "What is an essential singularity for a complex function $f(z)$ at $z_0$?", back: "A singularity where the principal part (negative powers) of the Laurent series has infinitely many non-zero terms.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2186", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $f(x) = \arctan(x)$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} (-1)^n \\frac{x^{2n+1}}{2n+1} = x - \\frac{x^3}{3} + \\frac{x^5}{5} - \dots$ (valid for $|x| \le 1$)", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2187", front: "What is the definition of a separable space in topology?", back: "A topological space that has a countable dense subset.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2188", front: "What is the integral of $\\text{arcsec}(x)$?", back: "$x \\text{arcsec}(x) - \\ln|x + \\sqrt{x^2 - 1}| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2189", front: "What is the Jordan Canonical Form (or Jordan normal form) of a matrix $A$?", back: "A block diagonal matrix $J$ similar to $A$, where each block is a Jordan block containing one eigenvalue on the diagonal.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2190", front: "What is the Isometry Theorem for Fourier Series?", back: "A statement equivalent to Parseval's identity, relating the $L^2$-norm of $f$ to the $l^2$-norm of its Fourier coefficients.", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2191", front: "What is the integral of $\\text{arccot}(x)$?", back: "$x \\text{arccot}(x) + \\frac{1}{2} \\ln(1 + x^2) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2192", front: "What is the Sylow $p$-subgroup of a finite group $G$?", back: "A subgroup $P$ of $G$ whose order is $p^n$, where $p^n$ is the highest power of the prime $p$ that divides the order of $G$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2193", front: "What is the formula for the Laplace Transform of a derivative $\mathcal{L}\\{f'(t)\\}$?", back: "$s F(s) - f(0)$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2194", front: "What is the Riemann Mapping Theorem?", back: "Any non-empty simply connected open subset of the complex plane $\mathbb{C}$ that is not $\mathbb{C}$ itself is conformally equivalent to the open unit disk $\mathbb{D}$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2195", front: "What is the definition of a null set in measure theory?", back: "A set $E$ whose Lebesgue measure is zero, $\mu(E) = 0$.", subject: "Measure Theory" },
    { id: "2196", front: "What is the mean value theorem for integrals?", back: "If $f$ is continuous on $[a, b]$, there exists a $c \in (a, b)$ such that $\\int_a^b f(x) \,dx = f(c)(b-a)$.", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2197", front: "What is the definition of the closure $\bar{A}$ of a set $A$ in a topological space?", back: "The smallest closed set containing $A$ (the union of $A$ and all its limit points).", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2198", front: "What is a Euclidean Domain?", back: "An integral domain $R$ that has a Euclidean norm (or function) $v: R \\setminus \{0\} \\to \mathbb{N} \cup \{0\}$ that satisfies the division algorithm (division with remainder).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2199", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $f(x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-x}}$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "The Binomial series $\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} \\binom{-1/2}{n} (-x)^n$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2200", front: "What is a linear system of ODEs?", back: "A system $\\mathbf{x}' = A(t)\mathbf{x} + \mathbf{f}(t)$, where the function $\mathbf{x}$ and its derivatives appear only to the first power and are not multiplied together.", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2201", front: "What is the formula for the Wronskian of $n$ functions $y_1, y_2, \dots, y_n$?", back: "$W(y_1, \dots, y_n) = \\det \\begin{pmatrix} y_1 & y_2 & \dots & y_n \\\\ y_1' & y_2' & \dots & y_n' \\\\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\\\ y_1^{(n-1)} & y_2^{(n-1)} & \dots & y_n^{(n-1)} \\end{pmatrix}$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2202", front: "What is the Cauchy integral formula for derivatives?", back: "$f^{(n)}(a) = \\frac{n!}{2\\pi i} \\oint_C \\frac{f(z)}{(z-a)^{n+1}} \,dz$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2203", front: "What is the $\mathbf{L^p}$ norm of a function $f$ on a measure space $X$?", back: "$||f||_p = \\left( \\int_X |f|^p \,d\mu \\right)^{1/p}$", subject: "Measure Theory/Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2204", front: "What is the basis for the field extension $\mathbb{Q}(\\sqrt{2})$ over $\mathbb{Q}$?", back: "The set $\{1, \\sqrt{2}\}$ (the dimension is 2).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2205", front: "What is the integral of $\\tan^2(x)$?", back: "$\\tan(x) - x + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2206", front: "What is a contractible space in algebraic topology?", back: "A topological space $X$ whose identity map $id_X$ is null-homotopic (homotopic to a constant map).", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2207", front: "What is the formula for the Fourier sine coefficient $b_n$ of a function $f(x)$ on $[0, L]$?", back: "$b_n = \\frac{2}{L} \\int_0^L f(x) \\sin(\\frac{n\\pi x}{L}) \,dx$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2208", front: "What is the $\mathbf{L^\\infty}$ norm (or essential supremum) of a function $f$?", back: "$||f||_{\\infty} = \\inf \\{ M \ge 0 \\mid |f(x)| \le M \text{ almost everywhere} \\}$", subject: "Measure Theory/Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2209", front: "What is the definition of a limit point (or cluster point) $x$ of a set $A$ in a topological space?", back: "Every open set containing $x$ also contains at least one point of $A$ different from $x$.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2210", front: "What is the Fredholm Alternative Theorem in functional analysis?", back: "Either $Ax = b$ has a unique solution, or $Ax = 0$ has a non-trivial solution (relates the solution of an equation to the solution of the associated homogeneous equation).", subject: "Linear Algebra/Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2211", front: "What is the integral of $\\sec^2(x)\\tan(x)$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{2} \\tan^2(x) + C$ (or $\\frac{1}{2} \\sec^2(x) + C$)", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2212", front: "What is the definition of the homotopy group $\\pi_n(X, x_0)$?", back: "The set of homotopy classes of maps $f: (S^n, s_0) \\to (X, x_0)$, where $S^n$ is the $n$-sphere.", subject: "Algebraic Topology" },
    { id: "2213", front: "What is the primitive root theorem in number theory?", back: "The multiplicative group of integers modulo $n$, $(\mathbb{Z}/n\\mathbb{Z})^$, is cyclic if and only if $n=2, 4, p^k,$ or $2p^k$, where $p$ is an odd prime and $k \ge 1$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2214", front: "What is the L-stable (or A-stable) property for a numerical method for ODEs?", back: "A numerical method that, when applied to the linear test equation $y' = \lambda y$ with $\text{Re}(\lambda) < 0$, the numerical solution tends to zero as $t \to \infty$ for any step size $h$.", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2215", front: "What is the formula for the Schwarz Reflection Principle (for analytic functions)?", back: "If $f$ is analytic in a domain $D$ symmetric with respect to the real axis, and $f$ is real on the real axis part of $D$, then $f(\\bar{z}) = \\overline{f(z)}$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2216", front: "What is the Taylor series for $\frac{1}{(1-x)^2}$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} n x^{n-1} = 1 + 2x + 3x^2 + 4x^3 + \dots$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2217", front: "What is the definition of a Radon-Nikodym derivative $\\frac{d\mu}{d\nu}$?", back: "The function $f$ such that $\mu(E) = \\int_E f \,d\nu$ for all measurable sets $E$ (exists if $\mu$ is absolutely continuous with respect to $\nu$).", subject: "Measure Theory" },
    { id: "2218", front: "What is the formula for the volume of a solid generated by rotating the area between $f(x)$ and $g(x)$ around the $x$-axis (Washer Method)?", back: "$V = \\int_a^b \pi ([f(x)]^2 - [g(x)]^2) \,dx$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2219", front: "What is a simple group?", back: "A group $G$ whose only normal subgroups are the trivial group $\{e\}$ and the group $G$ itself.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2220", front: "What is the Hahn-Banach Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "Under certain conditions, a bounded linear functional defined on a subspace of a vector space can be extended to the whole space without increasing its norm.", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2221", front: "What is the definition of a simply connected domain $D$ in $\mathbb{R}^2$?", back: "Every simple closed curve within $D$ encloses only points that are also in $D$ (no holes). Equivalently, the fundamental group is trivial.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2222", front: "What is the formula for the $\mathbf{n}$-th root of unity?", back: "$z_k = e^{i \\frac{2\\pi k}{n}} = \\cos(\\frac{2\\pi k}{n}) + i \\sin(\\frac{2\\pi k}{n})$ for $k = 0, 1, \dots, n-1$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2223", front: "What is the Sobolev space $W^{k, p}(\Omega)$?", back: "The set of functions in $L^p(\Omega)$ whose weak derivatives up to order $k$ also exist and are in $L^p(\Omega)$.", subject: "PDE/Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2224", front: "What is the integral of $\\sin^2(x)$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{2} x - \\frac{1}{4} \\sin(2x) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2225", front: "What is the definition of an Artinian Ring?", back: "A ring that satisfies the Descending Chain Condition (DCC) on ideals (every descending chain of ideals $I_1 \supseteq I_2 \supseteq \dots$ terminates).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2226", front: "What is the Dirichlet condition for Fourier series convergence?", back: "If $f$ is periodic, bounded, and has only a finite number of maxima, minima, and discontinuities in one period, the Fourier series converges to $\\frac{f(x^+) + f(x^-)}{2}$.", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2227", front: "What is the formula for the Laplace Transform of a convolution $\mathcal{L}\\{(f  g)(t)\\}$?", back: "$F(s)G(s)$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2228", front: "What is the definition of a Nowhere Dense Set in a topological space?", back: "A set $A$ whose closure $\\bar{A}$ has an empty interior.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2229", front: "What is the Weierstrass Approximation Theorem?", back: "Any continuous function on a closed interval $[a, b]$ can be uniformly approximated by polynomials.", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2230", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $f(x) = \tan(x)$ centered at $x=0$ (first few terms)?", back: "$x + \\frac{x^3}{3} + \\frac{2x^5}{15} + \dots$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2231", front: "What is the definition of a Normal Operator $T$ on a Hilbert space $H$?", back: "An operator that commutes with its adjoint, $T T^ = T^ T$.", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2232", front: "What is the formula for the Green's function $G(x, y)$ for a differential operator $L$?", back: "The solution to $L[G(x, y)] = \delta(x-y)$ (where $\delta$ is the Dirac delta function).", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2233", front: "What is a maximal element of a partially ordered set $(S, \le)$?", back: "An element $m \in S$ such that if $m \le x$, then $m = x$.", subject: "Set Theory/Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2234", front: "What is the $\mathbf{p}$-adic number system $\mathbb{Q}_p$?", back: "The completion of the field of rational numbers $\mathbb{Q}$ with respect to the $\mathbf{p}$-adic absolute value $|x|_p$.", subject: "Number Theory/Analysis" },
    { id: "2235", front: "What is the Picard's Great Theorem (for essential singularities)?", back: "In every neighborhood of an essential singularity, an analytic function takes on every possible complex value (except possibly one) infinitely often.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2236", front: "What is the formula for the mass $M$ of a wire $C$ with density $\rho(x, y, z)$?", back: "$M = \\int_C \rho(x, y, z) \,ds$", subject: "Vector Calculus" },
    { id: "2237", front: "What is the definition of a measurable function?", back: "A function $f: X \to Y$ such that the preimage of every open set (or Borel set) in $Y$ is a measurable set in $X$.", subject: "Measure Theory" },
    { id: "2238", front: "What is the Abel-Ruffini Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "The general quintic equation (or higher) cannot be solved by a finite sequence of radicals (i.e., root extractions) starting from the coefficients.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2239", front: "What is the integral of $\\cos^2(x)$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{2} x + \\frac{1}{4} \\sin(2x) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2240", front: "What is the Stone-Weierstrass Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "A continuous function on a compact Hausdorff space can be uniformly approximated by elements of an algebra of functions satisfying certain properties.", subject: "Real Analysis/Topology" },
    { id: "2241", front: "What is the general solution to the homogeneous ODE $y'' - 2\alpha y' + (\alpha^2 - \beta^2) y = 0$ (for distinct real roots $\alpha \pm \beta$)?", back: "$y(x) = c_1 e^{(\alpha + \beta)x} + c_2 e^{(\alpha - \beta)x}$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2242", front: "What is the Zorn's Lemma?", back: "If a partially ordered set $S$ has the property that every chain (totally ordered subset) has an upper bound in $S$, then $S$ contains at least one maximal element.", subject: "Set Theory/Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2243", front: "What is the definition of a Holomorphic Function?", back: "A complex-valued function of one or more complex variables that is complex-differentiable in a neighborhood of every point in its domain (equivalent to analytic).", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2244", front: "What is the formula for the moment of inertia $I_y$ of a planar lamina with density $\rho(x, y)$ about the $y$-axis?", back: "$I_y = \\iint_D x^2 \rho(x, y) \,dA$", subject: "Multivariable Calculus" },
    { id: "2245", front: "What is the Parseval's Identity for Fourier series?", back: "$\\frac{1}{\\pi} \\int_{-\\pi}^{\\pi} [f(x)]^2 \,dx = \\frac{a_0^2}{2} + \\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} (a_n^2 + b_n^2)$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2246", front: "What is a Noetherian Ring?", back: "A ring that satisfies the Ascending Chain Condition (ACC) on ideals (every ascending chain of ideals $I_1 \subseteq I_2 \subseteq \dots$ terminates).", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2247", front: "What is the formula for the fundamental solution to the wave equation $\\frac{\\partial^2 u}{\\partial t^2} - c^2 \\Delta u = 0$ in $\mathbb{R}^3$?", back: "$u(x, t) = \\frac{1}{4\\pi c^2 t} \\int_{|y-x|=ct} g(y) \,dS(y)$ (Kirchhoff's Formula for initial value $u(x, 0) = g(x)$, $\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t}(x, 0) = 0$).", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2248", front: "What is the integral of $\\text{sech}(x)$?", back: "$2 \\arctan(e^x) + C$ (or $\\arcsin(\\tanh(x)) + C$)", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2249", front: "What is the formula for the residue of a function $f(z)$ at a pole of order $m$ at $z_0$?", back: "$\\text{Res}_{z=z_0} f(z) = \\frac{1}{(m-1)!} \\lim_{z \\to z_0} \\frac{d^{m-1}}{dz^{m-1}} [(z-z_0)^m f(z)]$", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2250", front: "What is the definition of a Banach space?", back: "A complete normed vector space (complete with respect to the metric induced by the norm).", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2251", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\ln(1-x)$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$-\\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} \\frac{x^n}{n} = -x - \\frac{x^2}{2} - \\frac{x^3}{3} - \dots$ (valid for $|x| < 1$)", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2252", front: "What is the definition of a closed graph theorem (in functional analysis)?", back: "If $T: X \\to Y$ is a linear map between two Banach spaces, and its graph is closed in $X \\times Y$, then $T$ is continuous (bounded).", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2253", front: "What is the definition of a Lie group?", back: "A set that is both a group and a differentiable manifold, where the group operations (multiplication and inversion) are smooth maps.", subject: "Differential Geometry/Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2254", front: "What is the d'Alembert's solution to the one-dimensional wave equation $\\frac{\\partial^2 u}{\\partial t^2} = c^2 \\frac{\\partial^2 u}{\\partial x^2}$?", back: "$u(x, t) = f(x - ct) + g(x + ct)$ (sum of a right-moving and a left-moving wave).", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2255", front: "What is the integral of $\\coth(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\sinh(x)| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2256", front: "What is the definition of a complete metric space?", back: "A metric space in which every Cauchy sequence converges to a point within the space.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2257", front: "What is the Fourier Transform of the Dirac delta function $\\delta(t)$?", back: "$1$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2258", front: "What is the definition of a prime element $p$ in an integral domain $R$?", back: "A non-zero, non-unit element such that if $p$ divides $ab$, then $p$ divides $a$ or $p$ divides $b$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2259", front: "What is the Central Limit Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "The distribution of the sum (or average) of a large number of independent, identically distributed random variables approaches a normal distribution, regardless of the original distribution.", subject: "Probability/Statistics" },
    { id: "2260", front: "What is the Open Mapping Theorem (for Banach spaces)?", back: "If $T: X \\to Y$ is a surjective continuous linear map between two Banach spaces, then $T$ is an open map (maps open sets to open sets).", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2261", front: "What is the integral of $\\text{csch}(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\tanh(x/2)| + C$ (or $\\ln|\\frac{e^x - 1}{e^x + 1}| + C$)", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2262", front: "What is the method of characteristics used for in PDEs?", back: "To find solutions to first-order linear and quasilinear PDEs by reducing the PDE to a system of ODEs along characteristic curves.", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2263", front: "What is the definition of an algebraically closed field $F$?", back: "A field such that every non-constant polynomial with coefficients in $F$ has at least one root in $F$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2264", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\cos(x)$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} (-1)^n \\frac{x^{2n}}{(2n)!} = 1 - \\frac{x^2}{2!} + \\frac{x^4}{4!} - \dots$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2265", front: "What is the Banach Fixed Point Theorem (or Contraction Mapping Principle)?", back: "A contraction mapping on a complete metric space has a unique fixed point.", subject: "Topology/Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2266", front: "What is the heat equation (or diffusion equation)?", back: "$\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = k \\frac{\\partial^2 u}{\\partial x^2}$ (in 1D, where $k$ is the thermal diffusivity).", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2267", front: "What is the definition of a chain complex $(C_\bullet, d_\bullet)$?", back: "A sequence of Abelian groups (or modules) $\dots \\to C_{n+1} \\xrightarrow{d_{n+1}} C_n \\xrightarrow{d_n} C_{n-1} \\to \dots$ such that the composition of two consecutive maps is zero ($d_n \circ d_{n+1} = 0$).", subject: "Algebraic Topology" },
    { id: "2268", front: "What is the error term for the Trapezoidal Rule for numerical integration?", back: "$E_T \\le \\frac{M(b-a)^3}{12n^2}$, where $M = \\max |f''(x)|$ on $[a, b]$.", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2269", front: "What is the integral of $\\text{sech}^2(x)$?", back: "$\\tanh(x) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2270", front: "What is the term for a point $z_0$ where the complex function $f(z)$ is analytic, but its derivative $f'(z_0)=0$?", back: "Critical Point (or sometimes Zero of order $m > 1$ of $f'$).", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2271", front: "What is the definition of a limit $\\lim_{x \\to c} f(x) = L$ using $\\epsilon-\delta$?", back: "For every $\\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\\delta > 0$ such that if $0 < |x-c| < \\delta$, then $|f(x) - L| < \\epsilon$.", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2272", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\frac{1}{1-x^2}$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} x^{2n} = 1 + x^2 + x^4 + x^6 + \dots$ (valid for $|x| < 1$)", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2273", front: "What is the definition of a homology group $H_n(C_\bullet)$?", back: "The quotient group $\\text{Ker}(d_n) / \\text{Im}(d_{n+1})$ (cycles modulo boundaries) of a chain complex.", subject: "Algebraic Topology" },
    { id: "2274", front: "What is the formula for the Fourier Transform of a derivative $\\mathcal{F}\\{f'(t)\\}$?", back: "$i \\omega \\mathcal{F}(\\omega) = i \\omega F(\\omega)$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2275", front: "What is the Runge-Kutta method (RK4) used for?", back: "A family of numerical methods for approximating the solution of ordinary differential equations (ODEs), providing higher-order accuracy.", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2276", front: "What is the definition of a normal topological space ($T_4$ space)?", back: "A topological space where any two disjoint closed sets can be separated by disjoint open neighborhoods.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2277", front: "What is the maximum number of elements in a finite field $\mathbb{F}$?", back: "Always $p^n$ for some prime $p$ and integer $n \ge 1$.", subject: "Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2278", front: "What is the Poisson equation?", back: "$\\Delta u = f$ (where $\\Delta$ is the Laplacian, $\\nabla^2 u$). The homogeneous case ($f=0$) is the Laplace equation.", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2279", front: "What is the Hahn-Banach Separation Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "Two disjoint convex sets in a topological vector space can be separated by a hyperplane.", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2280", front: "What is the integral of $\\sin^3(x)$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{3} \\cos^3(x) - \\cos(x) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2281", front: "What is the Parseval's Identity for Fourier Transforms?", back: "$\\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} |f(t)|^2 \,dt = \\frac{1}{2\\pi} \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} |\\mathcal{F}(\\omega)|^2 \,d\\omega$ (conservation of energy/norm).", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2282", front: "What is the definition of a category $\mathcal{C}$?", back: "A collection of objects and a collection of morphisms (arrows) between objects, satisfying associativity and identity axioms.", subject: "Category Theory" },
    { id: "2283", front: "What is the formula for the heat kernel $K(x, t)$ in 1D?", back: "$K(x, t) = \\frac{1}{\\sqrt{4\\pi k t}} e^{-x^2/(4kt)}$", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2284", front: "What is the error term for the Midpoint Rule for numerical integration?", back: "$E_M \\le \\frac{M(b-a)^3}{24n^2}$, where $M = \\max |f''(x)|$ on $[a, b]$.", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2285", front: "What is the integral of $\\cos^3(x)$?", back: "$\\sin(x) - \\frac{1}{3} \\sin^3(x) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2286", front: "What is the Perron-Frobenius Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "For a real square matrix with positive entries, there exists a unique largest real eigenvalue (the Perron root), and the corresponding eigenvector can be chosen to have strictly positive components.", subject: "Linear Algebra" },
    { id: "2287", front: "What is the definition of a homotopy $H: X \times [0, 1] \\to Y$?", back: "A continuous map between two functions $f_0, f_1: X \\to Y$ such that $H(x, 0) = f_0(x)$ and $H(x, 1) = f_1(x)$ (a continuous deformation).", subject: "Algebraic Topology" },
    { id: "2288", front: "What is the Closed Subspace Test (for closedness of a linear subspace)?", back: "A subspace $W$ of a Banach space $X$ is closed if and only if it is a complete subspace (i.e., every Cauchy sequence in $W$ converges in $W$).", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2289", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\cosh(x)$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} \\frac{x^{2n}}{(2n)!} = 1 + \\frac{x^2}{2!} + \\frac{x^4}{4!} + \dots$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2290", front: "What is the domain of dependence for a solution to the wave equation at a point $(x_0, t_0)$?", back: "The region in the initial data space $t=0$ that influences the solution at $(x_0, t_0)$ (a cone extending backwards in time).", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2291", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{x^2 + a^2}$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{a} \\arctan(\\frac{x}{a}) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2292", front: "What is the definition of a functor $F: \mathcal{C} \\to \mathcal{D}$ between two categories?", back: "A map that sends objects in $\mathcal{C}$ to objects in $\mathcal{D}$ and morphisms in $\mathcal{C}$ to morphisms in $\mathcal{D}$, preserving composition and identity.", subject: "Category Theory" },
    { id: "2293", front: "What is the Heine-Borel Theorem (in $\mathbb{R}^n$)?", back: "A subset of $\mathbb{R}^n$ is compact if and only if it is closed and bounded.", subject: "Real Analysis/Topology" },
    { id: "2294", front: "What is the error term for Simpson's Rule for numerical integration?", back: "$E_S \\le \\frac{M(b-a)^5}{180n^4}$, where $M = \\max |f^{(4)}(x)|$ on $[a, b]$.", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2295", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{\\sqrt{x^2 + a^2}}$?", back: "$\\ln|x + \\sqrt{x^2 + a^2}| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2296", front: "What is the definition of a Banach Algebra?", back: "A Banach space (complete normed vector space) that is also an algebra over $\mathbb{R}$ or $\mathbb{C}$, and the multiplication operation is compatible with the norm ($||xy|| \le ||x|| ||y||$).", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2297", front: "What is the formula for the Laplace transform of $t^n f(t)$?", back: "$(-1)^n \\frac{d^n}{ds^n} F(s)$", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2298", front: "What is the Lax-Richtmyer equivalence theorem (for numerical PDE)?", back: "For a consistent linear finite difference method, stability is a necessary and sufficient condition for convergence.", subject: "Numerical Analysis/PDE" },
    { id: "2299", front: "What is the integral of $\\sqrt{a^2 - x^2}$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{2} x \\sqrt{a^2 - x^2} + \\frac{1}{2} a^2 \\arcsin(\\frac{x}{a}) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2300", front: "What is the definition of a limit superior (limsup) of a sequence $\{a_n\}$?", back: "$\\limsup_{n \\to \\infty} a_n = \\lim_{n \\to \\infty} (\\sup_{k \ge n} a_k)$ (the largest limit of a subsequence).", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2301", front: "What is the maximum modulus principle (for holomorphic functions)?", back: "If $f$ is a non-constant holomorphic function on a connected open set $D$, then $|f(z)|$ cannot attain its maximum value in the interior of $D$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2302", front: "What is the definition of the kernel of a functor $F: \mathcal{C} \\to \mathcal{D}$?", back: "The set of morphisms in $\mathcal{C}$ that map to the identity morphism in $\mathcal{D}$ (if $\mathcal{D}$ is an additive category).", subject: "Category Theory" },
    { id: "2303", front: "What is the Brouwer Fixed Point Theorem (in $\mathbb{R}^n$)?", back: "Every continuous function from a closed unit ball $D^n$ to itself has at least one fixed point.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2304", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{x \\sqrt{x^2 - a^2}}$?", back: "$\\frac{1}{a} \\text{arcsec}(\\frac{|x|}{a}) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2305", front: "What is the definition of the spectrum $\sigma(T)$ of a bounded linear operator $T$ on a Banach space?", back: "The set of all scalars $\lambda$ such that the operator $(T - \lambda I)$ is not invertible.", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2306", front: "What is the Hadamard's Example (for well-posedness of PDEs)?", back: "The Cauchy problem for the Laplace equation is ill-posed (solution does not depend continuously on the initial data).", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2307", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\sinh(x)$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} \\frac{x^{2n+1}}{(2n+1)!} = x + \\frac{x^3}{3!} + \\frac{x^5}{5!} + \dots$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2308", front: "What is the formula for the error in the Euler numerical method for ODEs?", back: "$E(h) = O(h)$ (The method is first-order accurate).", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2309", front: "What is the integral of $\\frac{1}{\\sqrt{a^2 - x^2}}$?", back: "$\\arcsin(\\frac{x}{a}) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2310", front: "What is the definition of a limit inferior (liminf) of a sequence $\{a_n\}$?", back: "$\\liminf_{n \\to \\infty} a_n = \\lim_{n \\to \\infty} (\\inf_{k \ge n} a_k)$ (the smallest limit of a subsequence).", subject: "Real Analysis" },
    { id: "2311", front: "What is the residue at infinity for a complex function $f(z)$?", back: "$\\text{Res}_{z=\\infty} f(z) = -\\frac{1}{2\\pi i} \\oint_C f(z) \,dz = -c_{-1}$ in the Laurent expansion of $f(1/w)$ around $w=0$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2312", front: "What is a Natural Transformation between two functors $F, G: \mathcal{C} \\to \mathcal{D}$?", back: "A collection of morphisms $\{\eta_A: F(A) \\to G(A)\\}$ for every object $A$ in $\mathcal{C}$ that satisfies a commutativity condition with all morphisms in $\mathcal{C}$.", subject: "Category Theory" },
    { id: "2313", front: "What is the Urysohn Metrization Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "A regular, $T_1$ topological space with a countable basis (a second countable space) is metrizable.", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2314", front: "What is the formula for the Backward Euler numerical method for $y' = f(t, y)$?", back: "$y_{i+1} = y_i + h f(t_{i+1}, y_{i+1})$ (an implicit method).", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2315", front: "What is the integral of $\\tan(x)$?", back: "$-\\ln|\\cos(x)| + C$ (or $\\ln|\\sec(x)| + C$)", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2316", front: "What is the definition of a self-adjoint operator $T$ (on a Hilbert space)?", back: "An operator equal to its adjoint, $T = T^$. (Equivalent to being Hermitian).", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2317", front: "What is the formula for the Fourier Transform of the convolution $(f  g)(t)$?", back: "$\\mathcal{F}\\{(f  g)(t)\\} = F(\\omega) G(\\omega)$ (the product of the transforms).", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2318", front: "What is the definition of the energy integral for the wave equation?", back: "$E(t) = \\int (\\frac{1}{2} (u_t^2 + c^2 |\\nabla u|^2)) \,dx$ (often used to show uniqueness and continuous dependence on data).", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2319", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\text{arcsec}(x)$ centered at $x=0$ (first few terms)?", back: "$\\frac{\\pi}{2} - \\frac{1}{x} - \\frac{1}{6x^3} - \dots$ (Note: does not have a simple power series expansion at $x=0$ but has a Maclaurin series for $\\frac{d}{dx} \\text{arcsec}(x)$).", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2320", front: "What is the integral of $\\cot(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\sin(x)| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2321", front: "What is the Argument Principle (in Complex Analysis)?", back: "$\\frac{1}{2\\pi i} \\oint_C \\frac{f'(z)}{f(z)} \,dz = N - P$, where $N$ is the number of zeros and $P$ is the number of poles of $f$ inside $C$ (counted with multiplicity).", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2322", front: "What is the concept of a Universal Property in Category Theory?", back: "A property that defines an object uniquely (up to isomorphism) by specifying the existence of a unique morphism to or from it for every object in the category.", subject: "Category Theory" },
    { id: "2323", front: "What is the Lebesgue Dominated Convergence Theorem (informal statement)?", back: "If a sequence of measurable functions $\{f_n\}$ converges pointwise almost everywhere to $f$, and is dominated by an integrable function $g$ ($|f_n| \le g$), then $f$ is integrable and $\\lim \\int f_n \,d\mu = \\int f \,d\mu$.", subject: "Measure Theory" },
    { id: "2324", front: "What is the formula for the Improved Euler (or Heun's) numerical method for $y' = f(t, y)$?", back: "$y_{i+1} = y_i + \\frac{h}{2} (f(t_i, y_i) + f(t_{i+1}, y_i + h f(t_i, y_i)))$ (a second-order method).", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2325", front: "What is the integral of $\\sec(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\sec(x) + \\tan(x)| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2326", front: "What is the definition of a Sobolev Embedding Theorem?", back: "The theorem that relates the Sobolev spaces $W^{k, p}$ to the continuous functions $C^m$ and $L^q$ spaces, establishing conditions for differentiability or higher integrability.", subject: "Functional Analysis/PDE" },
    { id: "2327", front: "What is the Gelfand-Mazur Theorem?", back: "Any normed division algebra over the complex numbers is isomorphic to the complex numbers $\mathbb{C}$ itself.", subject: "Functional Analysis/Abstract Algebra" },
    { id: "2328", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $f(x) = \tan^{-1}(x)$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} (-1)^n \\frac{x^{2n+1}}{2n+1}$", subject: "Series" },
    { id: "2329", front: "What is the integral of $\\csc(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\csc(x) - \\cot(x)| + C$ (or $-\\ln|\\csc(x) + \\cot(x)| + C$)", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2330", front: "What is the Dirichlet problem for the Laplace equation $\\Delta u = 0$?", back: "Finding a solution $u$ in a region $\Omega$ given its values on the boundary $\\partial \Omega$.", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2331", front: "What is the formula for the Fourier series of $f(x)$ on an interval $[-L, L]$?", back: "$f(x) = \\frac{a_0}{2} + \\sum_{n=1}^{\\infty} \\left[a_n \\cos(\\frac{n\\pi x}{L}) + b_n \\sin(\\frac{n\\pi x}{L})\\right]$", subject: "Harmonic Analysis" },
    { id: "2332", front: "What is the concept of a Zero Object $\mathbf{0}$ in a category?", back: "An object that is both an initial object (has a unique morphism to every object) and a terminal object (has a unique morphism from every object).", subject: "Category Theory" },
    { id: "2333", front: "What is the definition of a homeomorphism $f: X \to Y$?", back: "A bijective map that is continuous and has a continuous inverse $f^{-1}$ (a topological equivalence).", subject: "Topology" },
    { id: "2334", front: "What is the formula for the Midpoint Rule for numerical integration?", back: "$M_n = \\sum_{i=1}^n f(\\bar{x}_i) \\Delta x$, where $\\bar{x}_i$ is the midpoint of the $i$-th subinterval.", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2335", front: "What is the integral of $\\sinh(x)$?", back: "$\\cosh(x) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2336", front: "What is the $\mathbf{L^2}$ space, $L^2(\Omega)$?", back: "The space of square-integrable measurable functions on $\Omega$ (functions such that $\\int_{\Omega} |f|^2 \,d\mu < \\infty$).", subject: "Measure Theory/Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2337", front: "What is the formula for the Laplace transform of $e^{at} f(t)$?", back: "$F(s-a)$ (the frequency shifting property).", subject: "Differential Equations" },
    { id: "2338", front: "What is the definition of a compact operator $T: X \\to Y$ (between Banach spaces)?", back: "A linear operator that maps the bounded sets in $X$ to precompact sets (sets whose closure is compact) in $Y$.", subject: "Functional Analysis" },
    { id: "2339", front: "What is the integral of $\\cosh(x)$?", back: "$\\sinh(x) + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2340", front: "What is the Rouché's Theorem (in Complex Analysis)?", back: "If $|g(z)| < |f(z)|$ on a simple closed contour $C$, then $f(z)$ and $f(z) + g(z)$ have the same number of zeros inside $C$.", subject: "Complex Analysis" },
    { id: "2341", front: "What is the definition of a coequalizer in Category Theory?", back: "A universal construction defined by two parallel morphisms $f, g: A \\to B$, as an object $Q$ and a morphism $q: B \\to Q$ such that $qf = qg$, and it is the most economical object satisfying this property.", subject: "Category Theory" },
    { id: "2342", front: "What is the formula for the Euler numerical method for $y' = f(t, y)$?", back: "$y_{i+1} = y_i + h f(t_i, y_i)$", subject: "Numerical Analysis" },
    { id: "2343", front: "What is the integral of $\\tanh(x)$?", back: "$\\ln|\\cosh(x)| + C$", subject: "Calculus" },
    { id: "2344", front: "What is the method of separation of variables used for in PDEs?", back: "To solve linear, homogeneous PDEs by assuming the solution can be written as a product of functions, each depending on a single independent variable (e.g., $u(x, t) = X(x)T(t)$).", subject: "PDE" },
    { id: "2345", front: "What is the formula for the Taylor series of $\\frac{1}{1-x^3}$ centered at $x=0$?", back: "$\\sum_{n=0}^{\\infty} x^{3n} = 1 + x^3 + x^6 + x^9 + \dots$ (valid for $|x| < 1$)", subject: "Series" },
