    { id: "3283", front: "What is the term for a star that varies in brightness over time?", back: "Variable Star", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3284", front: "What kind of orbit is necessary for a satellite to appear stationary over a point on the Earth?", back: "Geostationary orbit", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3285", front: "What is the area of the sky immediately surrounding the Sun, visible during a total solar eclipse?", back: "Corona", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3286", front: "What is the term for the measure of a star's intrinsic brightness (how bright it actually is)?", back: "Absolute Magnitude", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3287", front: "What two characteristics are typically plotted on a Hertzsprung-Russell (H-R) Diagram?", back: "Luminosity/Brightness and Temperature/Color", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3288", front: "What type of nebula glows brightly after being energized by nearby hot stars?", back: "Emission Nebula", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3289", front: "What is the theoretical region of space surrounding a star where liquid water can exist on an orbiting planet?", back: "Habitable Zone (or Goldilocks Zone)", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3290", front: "What is the name of the mission that first landed humans on the Moon?", back: "Apollo 11", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3291", front: "What is the name of the largest known asteroid in the Asteroid Belt?", back: "Ceres", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3292", front: "What is the term for the force that attempts to pull a spinning body outward from its center of rotation (e.g., in a galaxy)?", back: "Centrifugal force (or simply inertia)", subject: "Physics/Astronomy" },
    { id: "3293", front: "Which planet has the moon Titan, known for its dense atmosphere and liquid methane lakes?", back: "Saturn", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3294", front: "What is the small, dense star remnant left after a low- to medium-mass star sheds its outer layers?", back: "White Dwarf", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3295", front: "What is the visible 'tail' of a comet primarily composed of?", back: "Dust and Ionized Gas (Plasma)", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3296", front: "What is the term for a planet that is composed primarily of rock and metal (e.g., Earth, Mars)?", back: "Terrestrial Planet", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3297", front: "What is the apparent westward drift of planets across the sky called?", back: "Retrograde Motion", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3298", front: "What is the name of the first operational space telescope launched by NASA?", back: "Hubble Space Telescope", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3299", front: "What is the process that converts hydrogen into helium in the Sun's core?", back: "Proton-proton chain (Nuclear Fusion)", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3300", front: "What is the term for the point in a stellar orbit where a star is closest to the observer?", back: "Periastron (or Pericenter)", subject: "Astronomy" },
    { id: "3301", front: "What is the scientific term for an animal's natural home or environment?", back: "Habitat", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3302", front: "What is the primary energy source for most ecosystems?", back: "The Sun", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3303", front: "What is the term for a non-native species introduced to an ecosystem that causes harm?", back: "Invasive species", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3304", front: "What gas is primarily responsible for the depletion of the ozone layer?", back: "Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3305", front: "What is the relationship where both species benefit?", back: "Mutualism", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3306", front: "What is the largest store of carbon on Earth (not including the atmosphere)?", back: "The Ocean (or Deep Ocean)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3307", front: "What is the term for the mass of living biological organisms in a given area or ecosystem?", back: "Biomass", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3308", front: "What process is carried out by bacteria and fungi that breaks down dead organic matter?", back: "Decomposition", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3309", front: "What is the increase in the concentration of toxins in organisms at successively higher levels in a food chain?", back: "Biomagnification", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3310", front: "What is the scientific term for the total role an organism plays in its community (its 'job')?", back: "Niche", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3311", front: "What is the term for an area of land saturated with water (like a swamp or marsh)?", back: "Wetland", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3312", front: "What is the level in a food chain where an organism gets its energy (e.g., producer, primary consumer)?", back: "Trophic level", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3313", front: "What is the major source of acid rain?", back: "Sulfur dioxide ($\\text{SO}_2$) and nitrogen oxides ($\\text{NO}_x$)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3314", front: "What is the maximum population size that an environment can sustain indefinitely?", back: "Carrying capacity", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3315", front: "What is the relationship where one organism benefits and the other is harmed?", back: "Parasitism (or Predation)", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3316", front: "What type of pollution is primarily caused by agricultural runoff of fertilizers?", back: "Nutrient pollution (leading to Eutrophication)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3317", front: "What are the first organisms to colonize a barren area and start the process of ecological succession?", back: "Pioneer species (e.g., lichens, mosses)", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3318", front: "What type of resources are naturally replenished over a short period of time (e.g., wind, solar)?", back: "Renewable resources", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3319", front: "What is the term for the interaction where one species benefits and the other is neither helped nor harmed?", back: "Commensalism", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3320", front: "What is the main process that releases carbon dioxide back into the atmosphere (other than burning fossil fuels)?", back: "Respiration", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3321", front: "What is the term for the loss of forests or trees in a given area?", back: "Deforestation", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3322", front: "What is the primary greenhouse gas released by burning fossil fuels?", back: "Carbon Dioxide ($\\text{CO}_2$)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3323", front: "What is the term for the non-living chemical and physical parts of the environment that affect living organisms (e.g., water, air, soil)?", back: "Abiotic factors", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3324", front: "What is the term for the living parts of the environment (e.g., plants, animals, fungi)?", back: "Biotic factors", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3325", front: "What is the term for a species that is not likely to become extinct in the near future, but is threatened?", back: "Vulnerable species (or Threatened)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3326", front: "What is the primary way nitrogen is converted into usable forms for plants?", back: "Nitrogen Fixation (by bacteria)", subject: "Ecology" },

    { id: "3329", front: "What is the term for a species that is essential to the health of an ecosystem; if removed, the ecosystem changes drastically?", back: "Keystone species", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3330", front: "What is the method of waste disposal that involves burning waste materials?", back: "Incineration", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3331", front: "What is the highest trophic level generally available in an ecosystem?", back: "Quaternary Consumer (or Apex Predator)", subject: "Ecology" },

    { id: "3334", front: "What is the process where a lake or pond gradually becomes filled with nutrients, leading to excessive plant growth and oxygen depletion?", back: "Eutrophication", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3335", front: "What is the largest terrestrial biome, characterized by coniferous forests?", back: "Taiga (Boreal Forest)", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3336", front: "What is the primary gas released from landfills as organic waste decomposes?", back: "Methane ($\\text{CH}_4$)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3337", front: "What is the term for an animal that only eats meat?", back: "Carnivore", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3338", front: "What type of resources cannot be naturally replenished in a human lifetime (e.g., coal, oil)?", back: "Non-renewable resources", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3339", front: "What is the area of the planet and atmosphere where living things exist?", back: "Biosphere", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3340", front: "What is the term for pollution that comes from a specific, identifiable source (e.g., a pipe)?", back: "Point source pollution", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3341", front: "What is the name for the diversity of genes within a single species?", back: "Genetic diversity", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3342", front: "What is the name given to the phenomenon of rising global average temperatures?", back: "Global Warming", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3343", front: "What is the term for organisms that eat dead or decaying organic matter?", back: "Detritivores (or Decomposers)", subject: "Ecology" },

    { id: "3345", front: "What is the scientific term for the study of the interactions between organisms and their environment?", back: "Ecology", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3346", front: "What is the term for pollution that comes from a widespread area and cannot be traced to a single source (e.g., agricultural runoff)?", back: "Non-point source pollution", subject: "Environmental Science" },

    { id: "3348", front: "What is the most energy-efficient level of the food chain for human consumption?", back: "Producer (Plants/Vegetables)", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3349", front: "What is the layer of the atmosphere that absorbs most of the Sun's harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation?", back: "Ozone Layer (in the Stratosphere)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3350", front: "What is the term for a resource whose use by one person reduces its availability for others (e.g., fish in the ocean)?", back: "Common-pool resource", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3351", front: "What is the term for a change in the frequency of a gene in a population over time?", back: "Evolution", subject: "Ecology" },

    { id: "3353", front: "What is the main chemical component of natural gas?", back: "Methane ($\\text{CH}_4$)", subject: "Environmental Science" },

    { id: "3355", front: "What is the name for an animal that only eats dead animals (e.g., vultures)?", back: "Scavenger", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3356", front: "What is the term for water that has been used in homes, industry, or agriculture and contains pollutants?", back: "Wastewater (or Sewage)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3357", front: "What is the process that converts solar energy into chemical energy?", back: "Photosynthesis", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3358", front: "What is the term for the biological process that creates a permanent hole in the ozone layer?", back: "Ozone Depletion", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3359", front: "What is the area where the land meets the sea called?", back: "Coastal zone (or Intertidal zone)", subject: "Environmental Science" },

    { id: "3361", front: "What is the name for the diversity of communities and ecosystems across a landscape?", back: "Ecosystem diversity", subject: "Ecology" },

    { id: "3364", front: "What is the main pollutant released by burning coal that causes mercury contamination?", back: "Mercury (Hg)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3365", front: "What is the term for the global movement of carbon atoms through the environment?", back: "Carbon Cycle", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3366", front: "What term describes the contamination of the atmosphere by harmful substances?", back: "Air Pollution", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3367", front: "What is the name for the diversity of species within an ecosystem?", back: "Species diversity", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3368", front: "What is the process of collecting and processing materials that would otherwise be thrown away as trash?", back: "Recycling", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3369", front: "What is the zone of the ocean where light penetrates and photosynthesis can occur?", back: "Photic zone (or Epipelagic zone)", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3370", front: "What is the main environmental problem associated with large-scale mining?", back: "Habitat destruction and water pollution (Acid Mine Drainage)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3371", front: "What is the scientific term for the process of natural selection?", back: "Survival of the fittest", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3372", front: "What is the term for a natural material or force that humans use for energy or resources?", back: "Natural Resource", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3373", front: "What is the largest terrestrial biome that receives the least amount of rainfall?", back: "Desert", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3374", front: "What is the process of converting atmospheric nitrogen gas into compounds that plants can absorb?", back: "Nitrogen fixation", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3375", front: "What term describes the contamination of water bodies (e.g., lakes, rivers, oceans)?", back: "Water Pollution", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3376", front: "What is the phenomenon where urban areas are significantly warmer than surrounding rural areas?", back: "Urban Heat Island Effect", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3377", front: "What is the long-term weather pattern of an area called?", back: "Climate", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3378", front: "What is the name for the diversity of genes within a population?", back: "Genetic variation", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3379", front: "What is the primary impact of rising global temperatures on the ocean?", back: "Ocean acidification and rising sea levels", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3380", front: "What is the term for a species that is not native but also does not cause harm to the ecosystem?", back: "Non-native species (or Exotic species)", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3381", front: "What is the process of capturing and storing atmospheric carbon dioxide?", back: "Carbon sequestration", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3382", front: "What is the name for the diversity of species in a given geographical area?", back: "Regional diversity", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3383", front: "What is the process by which soil loses its fertility and ability to support plant life?", back: "Soil degradation", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3384", front: "What are the two major factors used to classify biomes?", back: "Temperature and Precipitation", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3385", front: "What is the term for the cutting down and removal of all trees in an area?", back: "Clear-cutting", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3386", front: "What is the relationship where two species compete for the same limited resource?", back: "Competition", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3387", front: "What is the term for the variety of life on Earth at all levels?", back: "Biodiversity", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3388", front: "What is the primary material used in landfills to cover garbage and prevent smells/pests?", back: "Soil (or clay)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3389", front: "What is the term for a species facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild?", back: "Endangered species", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3390", front: "What is the general term for the large, natural movement of air in the atmosphere?", back: "Wind (or Atmospheric Circulation)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3391", front: "What is the term for the final, stable community in ecological succession?", back: "Climax community", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3392", front: "What type of energy uses the heat trapped beneath the Earth's surface?", back: "Geothermal energy", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3393", front: "What is the term for a community of living organisms interacting with each other and their non-living environment?", back: "Ecosystem", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3394", front: "What is the term for a substance that causes cancer?", back: "Carcinogen", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3395", front: "What is the relationship between $\\text{CO}_2$ concentration and global temperature over the last million years?", back: "Directly correlated (as one increases, the other increases)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3396", front: "What is the primary way that heat is transferred through the Earth's atmosphere?", back: "Convection", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3397", front: "What is the largest biome in the world, covering about $70\%$ of the Earth's surface?", back: "Marine biome (Ocean)", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3398", front: "What is the term for the intentional release of toxic material into the environment in violation of environmental laws?", back: "Illegal dumping (or midnight dumping)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3399", front: "What is the maximum number of trophic levels typically found in an ecosystem?", back: "Usually 4 or 5", subject: "Ecology" },
    { id: "3400", front: "What is the term for the protective shell of rock and soil that shields groundwater from surface contamination?", back: "Aquiclude (or Confining Layer)", subject: "Environmental Science" },
    { id: "3401", front: "What is the process of copying a gene's DNA sequence into an RNA molecule?", back: "Transcription", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3402", front: "What is the site of protein synthesis in a cell?", back: "Ribosome", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3403", front: "What are the four nucleotide bases in DNA?", back: "Adenine (A), Thymine (T), Guanine (G), Cytosine (C)", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3404", front: "What is the term for a permanent change in the DNA sequence?", back: "Mutation", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3405", front: "What is the process of converting the mRNA code into a specific sequence of amino acids (protein)?", back: "Translation", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3406", front: "What is the complete set of genetic instructions in an organism called?", back: "Genome", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3407", front: "What type of cell division produces gametes (sex cells)?", back: "Meiosis", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3408", front: "What are alternative forms of a gene called?", back: "Alleles", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3409", front: "What scientific field involves manipulating an organism's genes?", back: "Genetic Engineering", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3410", front: "What structure do DNA and associated proteins condense into during cell division?", back: "Chromosome", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3411", front: "What is the 'sugar' component of the DNA backbone?", back: "Deoxyribose", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3412", front: "What is the physical appearance or observable traits of an organism called?", back: "Phenotype", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3413", front: "What enzyme is primarily responsible for synthesizing new DNA strands during replication?", back: "DNA Polymerase", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3414", front: "What are segments of DNA that code for a specific protein?", back: "Genes", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3415", front: "What is the term for having two identical alleles for a particular gene?", back: "Homozygous", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3416", front: "What is the term for the entire collection of proteins expressed by a cell, tissue, or organism?", back: "Proteome", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3417", front: "What type of RNA carries amino acids to the ribosome?", back: "Transfer RNA (tRNA)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3418", front: "What term describes an allele that is always expressed when present?", back: "Dominant allele", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3419", front: "What are pieces of DNA that jump or move from one location in the genome to another called?", back: "Transposons (or 'Jumping Genes')", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3420", front: "What is the 'start' codon for protein synthesis?", back: "AUG (Methionine)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3421", front: "What is the primary difference in structure between DNA and RNA?", back: "DNA is double-stranded; RNA is single-stranded (and RNA uses Uracil instead of Thymine)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3422", front: "What is the specific location of a gene on a chromosome?", back: "Locus", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3423", front: "What does PCR stand for in molecular biology?", back: "Polymerase Chain Reaction", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3424", front: "What scientist is considered the 'father of modern genetics' for his work with pea plants?", back: "Gregor Mendel", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3425", front: "What is the probability of two heterozygous parents (Aa x Aa) having an offspring that is homozygous dominant (AA)?", back: "$25\%$ or $1/4$", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3426", front: "What is the sugar component of the RNA backbone?", back: "Ribose", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3427", front: "What is the term for the process where a cell or organism takes up foreign DNA from its environment?", back: "Transformation", subject: "Microbiology/Genetics" },
    { id: "3428", front: "What type of bond connects the sugar and phosphate groups in the DNA backbone?", back: "Phosphodiester bond", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3429", front: "What are the non-coding regions within a gene that are spliced out of the mRNA?", back: "Introns", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3430", front: "What is the term for a cell containing two complete sets of chromosomes (2n)?", back: "Diploid", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3431", front: "What is the process that allows a single gene to code for multiple different proteins?", back: "Alternative Splicing", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3432", front: "What is the study of changes in gene activity that do not involve changes to the underlying DNA sequence?", back: "Epigenetics", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3433", front: "What is the term for having two different alleles for a particular gene?", back: "Heterozygous", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3434", front: "What scientist discovered the structure of DNA (the double helix)?", back: "Watson and Crick (often including Rosalind Franklin's work)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3435", front: "What type of mutation results in a single nucleotide base being substituted for another?", back: "Point mutation (or Substitution)", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3436", front: "What are the three-base sequences on mRNA that specify an amino acid?", back: "Codons", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3437", front: "What is the name of the theory that states DNA is transcribed to RNA, which is then translated to protein?", back: "The Central Dogma of Molecular Biology", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3438", front: "What type of cell division produces two identical daughter cells?", back: "Mitosis", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3439", front: "In DNA, what base does Adenine (A) pair with?", back: "Thymine (T)", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3440", front: "What enzyme unwinds the double helix during DNA replication?", back: "Helicase", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3441", front: "What is the term for a cell containing one complete set of chromosomes (n)?", back: "Haploid", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3442", front: "What type of RNA is a component of the ribosome structure?", back: "Ribosomal RNA (rRNA)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3443", front: "What is the term for a segment of a chromosome that is inverted (flipped) end-to-end?", back: "Inversion", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3444", front: "What technique separates DNA fragments by size using an electric current?", back: "Gel Electrophoresis", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3445", front: "What term describes the combined action of two or more genes influencing a single trait?", back: "Polygenic inheritance", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3446", front: "What is the complementary sequence to the DNA strand $5'$-ATTCG-$3'$?", back: "$3'$-TAAGC-$5'$", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3447", front: "What are short fragments of DNA created on the lagging strand during DNA replication?", back: "Okazaki fragments", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3448", front: "What is the genetic makeup of an organism (the specific alleles it possesses)?", back: "Genotype", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3449", front: "What are the segments of a gene that remain in the final messenger RNA (mRNA) molecule?", back: "Exons", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3450", front: "What is the relationship between alleles where both are fully expressed in the heterozygous state (e.g., AB blood type)?", back: "Co-dominance", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3451", front: "What is the process that creates variation by exchanging genetic material between homologous chromosomes during meiosis?", back: "Crossing Over (or Recombination)", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3452", front: "What is the complementary base for Adenine (A) in RNA?", back: "Uracil (U)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3453", front: "What are plasmids typically used for in genetic engineering?", back: "Vectors (to carry and replicate foreign DNA in bacteria)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3454", front: "What are genes located on the sex chromosomes (X or Y) called?", back: "Sex-linked genes", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3455", front: "What term describes the cell's tendency to divide, a process often uncontrolled in cancer?", back: "Proliferation", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3456", front: "What type of mutation results from the insertion or deletion of one or two nucleotides, often shifting the reading frame?", back: "Frameshift mutation", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3457", front: "What enzyme is used in reverse transcription?", back: "Reverse Transcriptase", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3458", front: "What is the term for a visual display of an individual's chromosomes, arranged in homologous pairs?", back: "Karyotype", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3459", front: "What are the protective structures at the ends of chromosomes that shorten with age?", back: "Telomeres", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3460", front: "What are the specialized structures that pull sister chromatids apart during anaphase of mitosis?", back: "Spindle fibers (or Microtubules)", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3461", front: "What is the term for a gene that, when mutated, can drive the growth of cancer?", back: "Oncogene", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3462", front: "What type of bond holds complementary nitrogenous bases together in the DNA helix?", back: "Hydrogen bonds", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3463", front: "What is the phenomenon where a single gene can influence multiple unrelated phenotypic traits?", back: "Pleiotropy", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3464", front: "What is the name for the protein that DNA wraps around to form chromatin?", back: "Histone", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3465", front: "What is the name of the first mammal successfully cloned from an adult somatic cell?", back: "Dolly the Sheep", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3466", front: "What is the term for the process of creating genetically identical copies of a cell or an organism?", back: "Cloning", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3467", front: "What term describes the blending of traits in a heterozygous individual (e.g., a red and white flower making pink)?", back: "Incomplete Dominance", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3468", front: "What is the term for the failure of chromosomes to separate properly during cell division?", back: "Nondisjunction", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3469", front: "What is the specific region of the ribosome where the new polypeptide chain is synthesized?", back: "P-site (Peptidyl site)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3470", front: "What is the name of the human disease caused by trisomy of chromosome 21?", back: "Down Syndrome", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3471", front: "What is the general term for substances that cause mutations?", back: "Mutagens", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3472", front: "What is the type of horizontal gene transfer where a virus (bacteriophage) carries DNA between bacteria?", back: "Transduction", subject: "Microbiology/Genetics" },
    { id: "3473", front: "What is the term for the removal of introns and joining of exons in the formation of mature mRNA?", back: "RNA Splicing", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3474", front: "What are the regions of the tRNA molecule that are complementary to the mRNA codon?", back: "Anticodon", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3475", front: "What is the term for the transfer of genetic material between two bacterial cells via direct contact (pili)?", back: "Conjugation", subject: "Microbiology/Genetics" },
    { id: "3476", front: "What technique uses short, synthetic DNA sequences (primers) to locate and amplify a specific sequence?", back: "PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3477", front: "What is the term for a gene that, when working normally, helps prevent cancer?", back: "Tumor suppressor gene", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3478", front: "What is the difference between a nucleoside and a nucleotide?", back: "Nucleotide has a phosphate group; Nucleoside does not", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3479", front: "What is the term for the percentage of individuals with a given genotype who exhibit the expected phenotype?", back: "Penetrance", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3480", front: "What is the purpose of the 5' cap and Poly-A tail added to eukaryotic mRNA?", back: "Protect the mRNA from degradation and aid in translation/export", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3481", front: "What enzyme catalyzes the formation of the peptide bond between amino acids?", back: "Peptidyl transferase (a ribozyme component of the ribosome)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3482", front: "What is the term for when an organism has more than two complete sets of chromosomes?", back: "Polyploidy", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3483", front: "What type of mutation changes a codon for one amino acid into a stop codon?", back: "Nonsense mutation", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3484", front: "What type of virus uses reverse transcriptase to copy its RNA genome into DNA?", back: "Retrovirus", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3485", front: "What is the term for a short, non-coding RNA molecule that helps regulate gene expression?", back: "MicroRNA (miRNA)", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3486", front: "What is the general term for all the metabolic chemical reactions that occur within a cell?", back: "Metabolism", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3487", front: "What is the term for a segment of DNA that is copied and inserted into a non-homologous chromosome?", back: "Translocation", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3488", front: "What are the proteins that bind to the operator region of DNA to inhibit gene expression?", back: "Repressors", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3489", front: "What is the term for a group of genes that operate together and share a common promoter (common in bacteria)?", back: "Operon", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3490", front: "What is the term for a population that is genetically identical due to asexual reproduction?", back: "Clone", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3491", front: "What are the repeating units of DNA, histone proteins, and linker DNA that make up chromatin?", back: "Nucleosomes", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3492", front: "What is the main function of restriction enzymes?", back: "Cut DNA at specific recognition sequences", subject: "Molecular Biology" },
    { id: "3493", front: "What is the process of gene flow (the movement of alleles) between populations?", back: "Migration", subject: "Genetics" },
    { id: "3494", front: "What type of immunity is inherited from parents (e.g., antibodies passed through breast milk)?", back: "Passive immunity", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3495", front: "What is the name for the protein coat that surrounds the genetic material of a virus?", back: "Capsid", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3496", front: "What is the main mode of reproduction for bacteria?", back: "Binary Fission", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3497", front: "What is the term for a disease-causing organism?", back: "Pathogen", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3498", front: "What is the term for the complete killing of all microorganisms and their spores?", back: "Sterilization", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3499", front: "What are substances produced by microorganisms that kill or inhibit the growth of other microorganisms?", back: "Antibiotics", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3500", front: "What is the outermost layer of a bacterial cell that provides structural support and protection?", back: "Cell wall", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3501", front: "What part of the human brain is the center for memory, emotion, and learning?", back: "Limbic system (including the hippocampus and amygdala)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3502", front: "What protein is responsible for muscle contraction (sliding past another protein)?", back: "Actin (sliding past Myosin)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3503", front: "What is the primary function of insulin?", back: "To lower blood glucose levels", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3504", front: "What are the smallest blood vessels, where gas and nutrient exchange occurs?", back: "Capillaries", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3505", front: "What is the tough, fibrous protein that forms hair, nails, and the outer layer of skin?", back: "Keratin", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3506", front: "What part of the autonomic nervous system is activated during the 'fight-or-flight' response?", back: "Sympathetic nervous system", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3507", front: "What is the scientific term for the windpipe?", back: "Trachea", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3508", front: "What structure in the ear is responsible for maintaining balance?", back: "Semicircular canals (vestibular system)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3509", front: "What is the wave of electrical activity that travels down a neuron?", back: "Action potential", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3510", front: "What enzyme in saliva begins the breakdown of starches?", back: "Amylase", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3511", front: "What is the main organ of the central nervous system?", back: "Brain", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3512", front: "What type of muscle is found in the walls of the heart?", back: "Cardiac muscle", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3513", front: "What hormone is secreted by the pineal gland and regulates sleep cycles?", back: "Melatonin", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3514", front: "What are the functional filtration units of the kidney?", back: "Nephrons", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3515", front: "What is the term for maintaining a stable internal environment in the body?", back: "Homeostasis", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3516", front: "What are the two major divisions of the nervous system?", back: "Central Nervous System (CNS) and Peripheral Nervous System (PNS)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3517", front: "What part of the long bone produces blood cells?", back: "Bone marrow (specifically, red bone marrow)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3518", front: "What disease is caused by the body's inability to produce or respond to insulin?", back: "Diabetes Mellitus", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3519", front: "What is the thin, transparent layer that covers the front of the eye and bends light?", back: "Cornea", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3520", front: "What is the liquid part of blood that carries cells, nutrients, and hormones?", back: "Plasma", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3521", front: "What is the primary function of white blood cells (Leukocytes)?", back: "Immune defense (fighting infection)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3522", front: "What is the largest tendon in the human body?", back: "Achilles tendon (Calcaneal tendon)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3523", front: "What is the main purpose of the small intestine?", back: "Absorption of nutrients", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3524", front: "What structure connects the nervous system to the endocrine system (often called the 'master control center')?", back: "Hypothalamus", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3525", front: "What type of joint allows for the greatest range of motion (e.g., shoulder, hip)?", back: "Ball-and-socket joint", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3526", front: "What is the name of the smallest bone in the human body?", back: "Stapes (in the middle ear)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3527", front: "What are the tiny projections lining the small intestine that increase surface area for absorption?", back: "Villi (and microvilli)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3528", front: "What is the term for the muscle state of slight, sustained contraction that maintains posture?", back: "Muscle tone", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3529", front: "What part of the brain coordinates voluntary movements, balance, and posture?", back: "Cerebellum", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3530", front: "What is the medical term for the voice box?", back: "Larynx", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3531", front: "What is the term for the volume of air breathed in or out during a normal breath?", back: "Tidal volume", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3532", front: "What type of microorganism causes the disease influenza?", back: "Virus", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3533", front: "What protein is responsible for the red color and oxygen-carrying capacity of red blood cells?", back: "Hemoglobin", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3534", front: "What is the process by which immune cells engulf and destroy foreign particles (cell eating)?", back: "Phagocytosis", subject: "Microbiology/Physiology" },
    { id: "3535", front: "What is the scientific term for the contraction phase of the heartbeat (when the heart pushes blood out)?", back: "Systole", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3536", front: "What are the spiral-shaped bacteria called?", back: "Spirochetes", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3537", front: "What is the term for the body's second line of defense (e.g., inflammation, fever)?", back: "Innate immunity (non-specific)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3538", front: "What are the round or spherical bacteria called?", back: "Cocci (singular: Coccus)", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3539", front: "What is the name of the female sex hormone primarily involved in regulating the menstrual cycle?", back: "Estrogen", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3540", front: "What are infectious agents made only of protein that cause diseases like Mad Cow Disease?", back: "Prions", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3541", front: "What is the organ that produces bile and helps detoxify blood?", back: "Liver", subject: "Physiology" },

    { id: "3543", front: "What is the main function of the digestive enzyme pepsin?", back: "Breaks down proteins in the stomach", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3544", front: "What are the rod-shaped bacteria called?", back: "Bacilli (singular: Bacillus)", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3545", front: "What part of the human brain controls vital functions like breathing and heart rate?", back: "Brainstem (specifically, the Medulla Oblongata)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3546", front: "What is the term for microorganisms that live on or in a host without causing disease?", back: "Commensals (or Normal Flora/Microbiota)", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3547", front: "What immune cells produce antibodies?", back: "B cells (specifically, Plasma B cells)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3548", front: "What is the protective outer layer that forms around some bacteria to help them survive harsh conditions?", back: "Endospore (or Spore)", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3549", front: "What is the main function of the thyroid gland?", back: "Produce hormones that regulate metabolism", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3550", front: "What does HIV stand for?", back: "Human Immunodeficiency Virus", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3551", front: "What is the medical term for the resting phase of the heartbeat (when the heart fills with blood)?", back: "Diastole", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3552", front: "What is the process of weakening a pathogen so it can be used to stimulate an immune response (a vaccine)?", back: "Attenuation", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3553", front: "What is the protective, fatty layer that insulates the axon of a neuron?", back: "Myelin sheath", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3554", front: "What is the term for the sudden appearance of a disease in a large number of people in a region?", back: "Epidemic", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3555", front: "What is the main function of the sensory neurons?", back: "Carry information from sensory receptors to the CNS", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3556", front: "What type of microorganism are yeast and mold?", back: "Fungi", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3557", front: "What hormone is responsible for the maturation of T cells in the immune system?", back: "Thymosin (produced by the Thymus gland)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3558", front: "What is the study of disease patterns in populations called?", back: "Epidemiology", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3559", front: "What is the scientific term for low blood pressure?", back: "Hypotension", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3560", front: "What is the term for a worldwide epidemic?", back: "Pandemic", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3561", front: "What is the main function of the motor neurons?", back: "Carry information from the CNS to muscles and glands", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3562", front: "What is the clear, circular area that results when bacteria are killed by a virus on a culture plate?", back: "Plaque", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3563", front: "What organelle in the muscle cell stores and releases calcium ions for muscle contraction?", back: "Sarcoplasmic Reticulum", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3564", front: "What type of organism is Plasmodium, which causes malaria?", back: "Protozoan (a type of Protist)", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3565", front: "What are the cells that support, nourish, and protect neurons?", back: "Neuroglia (or Glial cells)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3566", front: "What is the term for the process of using heat to kill most of the harmful microbes in food (like milk)?", back: "Pasteurization", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3567", front: "What is the name for the tiny space between two neurons or between a neuron and a muscle cell?", back: "Synapse", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3568", front: "What is the term for a pathogen that normally does not cause disease but can if the host's immunity is weakened?", back: "Opportunistic pathogen", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3569", front: "What two main components make up the central nervous system (CNS)?", back: "Brain and Spinal Cord", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3570", front: "What is the term for an infectious disease that can be transmitted from animals to humans?", back: "Zoonotic disease (or Zoonosis)", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3571", front: "What is the name of the valve between the right atrium and the right ventricle of the heart?", back: "Tricuspid valve", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3572", front: "What is the term for a chemical substance that transmits a signal from one neuron to the next?", back: "Neurotransmitter", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3573", front: "What is the main function of the large intestine?", back: "Absorption of water and electrolytes", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3574", front: "What is the primary site of nutrient absorption in the human body?", back: "Small Intestine", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3575", front: "What is the scientific term for the windpipe?", back: "Trachea", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3576", front: "What part of the autonomic nervous system is activated during the 'rest-and-digest' response?", back: "Parasympathetic nervous system", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3577", front: "What hormone is secreted by the adrenal glands and increases heart rate and blood pressure?", back: "Adrenaline (or Epinephrine)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3578", front: "What are the cells responsible for sight in dim light?", back: "Rods", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3579", front: "What organ is primarily responsible for detoxification and production of clotting factors?", back: "Liver", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3580", front: "What is the term for an organism that causes disease (e.g., bacteria, viruses, fungi)?", back: "Pathogen", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3581", front: "What type of immunity involves a person's body producing its own antibodies after exposure to an antigen?", back: "Active Immunity", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3582", front: "What part of the bacterial cell is the site of cellular respiration in the absence of mitochondria?", back: "Cell Membrane (or Cytoplasmic Membrane)", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3583", front: "What are the cells responsible for color vision?", back: "Cones", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3584", front: "What is the name for the process of using chemical energy (instead of light) to produce food?", back: "Chemosynthesis", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3585", front: "What is the main function of platelets (Thrombocytes)?", back: "Blood clotting (hemostasis)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3586", front: "What is the scientific term for fever?", back: "Pyrexia", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3587", front: "What is the hormone released by the stomach that stimulates acid secretion?", back: "Gastrin", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3588", front: "What is the term for a small, self-replicating circle of DNA found in many bacteria?", back: "Plasmid", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3589", front: "What is the name of the valve between the left atrium and the left ventricle of the heart?", back: "Mitral valve (or Bicuspid valve)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3590", front: "What are substances that cause an allergic reaction in a susceptible person?", back: "Allergens", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3591", front: "What is the primary function of the cerebellum?", back: "Coordination of voluntary movement, balance, and posture", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3592", front: "What is the main cause of antibiotic resistance?", back: "Overuse and misuse of antibiotics", subject: "Microbiology" },
    { id: "3593", front: "What is the name of the large tube that carries blood from the heart to the rest of the body?", back: "Aorta", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3594", front: "What is the term for a specific, often painful, contraction of a muscle or muscle group?", back: "Cramp (or Spasm)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3595", front: "What is the purpose of the chorionic villi in pregnancy?", back: "Maximize surface area for nutrient/gas exchange between mother and fetus", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3596", front: "What is the term for the total volume of air that can be expelled from the lungs after maximum inhalation?", back: "Vital capacity", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3597", front: "What organ in the lymphatic system is responsible for filtering blood and removing old red blood cells?", back: "Spleen", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3598", front: "What is the main function of the hormone Glucagon?", back: "To raise blood glucose levels", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3599", front: "What is the main function of helper T cells in the immune system?", back: "Coordinate the immune response (activate B cells and other T cells)", subject: "Physiology" },
    { id: "3600", front: "What is the term for the unique set of surface molecules on a pathogen that trigger an immune response?", back: "Antigen", subject: "Microbiology/Physiology" },
    { id: "3601", front: "What fundamental constant relates a photon's energy ($E$) to its frequency ($\\nu$)?", back: "Planck's constant ($h$), in the equation $E = h\\nu$", subject: "Quantum Physics" },
    { id: "3602", front: "What is the study of how heat energy is converted into mechanical work (and vice versa)?", back: "Thermodynamics", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3603", front: "What does the Zeroth Law of Thermodynamics define?", back: "Thermal Equilibrium (if A is in equilibrium with C, and B is in equilibrium with C, then A and B are in equilibrium)", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3604", front: "What is the tendency of a system to move toward disorder or randomness (measured as $S$)?", back: "Entropy", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3605", front: "What does the First Law of Thermodynamics state?", back: "Energy is conserved (The change in internal energy equals heat added minus work done: $\\Delta U = Q - W$)", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3606", front: "What concept states that the speed of light in a vacuum is the same for all observers, regardless of their motion?", back: "Special Relativity (Einstein's Postulate)", subject: "Modern Physics" },
    { id: "3607", front: "What is the SI unit of electric potential difference (or voltage)?", back: "Volt (V)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3608", front: "What is the term for a material that allows electric current to flow easily?", back: "Conductor", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3609", front: "What principle states that it is impossible to know both the exact position and the exact momentum of a particle simultaneously?", back: "Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle", subject: "Quantum Physics" },
    { id: "3610", front: "What is the conversion of mass into energy described by Einstein's famous equation?", back: "$E = mc^2$", subject: "Modern Physics" },
    { id: "3611", front: "What is the resistance of a circuit element that is zero when current flows in one direction and very high in the opposite direction?", back: "Diode", subject: "Electronics" },
    { id: "3612", front: "What is the term for the maximum displacement or distance moved by a point on a vibrating body or wave from its equilibrium position?", back: "Amplitude", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3613", front: "What type of heat transfer occurs through direct contact between particles?", back: "Conduction", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3614", front: "What is the term for the bending of waves around obstacles or through an opening?", back: "Diffraction", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3615", front: "What does the Second Law of Thermodynamics state about entropy?", back: "The total entropy of an isolated system can never decrease (it must remain constant or increase)", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3616", front: "What are the particles that mediate the electromagnetic force?", back: "Photons", subject: "Particle Physics" },
    { id: "3617", front: "What is the SI unit of electrical capacitance?", back: "Farad (F)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3618", front: "What is the term for a substance with magnetic properties only when an external magnetic field is applied?", back: "Paramagnetic", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3619", front: "What principle explains the stability of atoms by stating that no two electrons can occupy the same quantum state simultaneously?", back: "Pauli Exclusion Principle", subject: "Quantum Physics" },
    { id: "3620", front: "What is the term for the process in which an electric current is induced by a changing magnetic field?", back: "Electromagnetic Induction (Faraday's Law)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3621", front: "What does AC stand for in electrical engineering?", back: "Alternating Current", subject: "Electronics" },
    { id: "3622", front: "What is the scientific term for the total range of electromagnetic waves, from radio waves to gamma rays?", back: "Electromagnetic Spectrum", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3623", front: "What is the term for the energy required to raise the temperature of a substance by one degree Celsius (or Kelvin)?", back: "Specific Heat Capacity", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3624", front: "What phenomenon occurs when light waves combine to form a wave with a greater (constructive) or lesser (destructive) amplitude?", back: "Interference", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3625", front: "What is the study of matter and energy at the atomic and subatomic level?", back: "Quantum Mechanics", subject: "Quantum Physics" },
    { id: "3626", front: "What type of lens is thicker in the middle and causes light rays to converge (focus)?", back: "Convex lens (or Converging lens)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3627", front: "What is the term for the minimum energy required to remove an electron from a neutral atom in its ground state?", back: "Ionization Energy", subject: "Chemistry/Physics" },
    { id: "3628", front: "What is the term for the force exerted by a gas per unit area on its container?", back: "Pressure", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3629", front: "What is the primary way the sun transfers heat energy to the Earth?", back: "Radiation", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3630", front: "What principle explains why a rapidly moving fluid (like air or water) exerts less pressure than a slow-moving fluid?", back: "Bernoulli's Principle", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3631", front: "What is the SI unit of magnetic flux?", back: "Weber (Wb)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3632", front: "What is the phenomenon where a changing magnetic field creates an electric field (the basis for generators)?", back: "Faraday's Law of Induction", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3633", front: "What is the term for a wave in which the oscillations are perpendicular to the direction of wave travel?", back: "Transverse wave", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3634", front: "What property of a material dictates how much it resists the flow of heat?", back: "Thermal Conductivity", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3635", front: "What type of materials are crucial to computer chips and have conductivity between that of a conductor and an insulator?", back: "Semiconductors", subject: "Electronics" },
    { id: "3636", front: "What is the term for a physical quantity that has both magnitude and direction?", back: "Vector (e.g., velocity, force)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3637", front: "What does the Third Law of Thermodynamics state about absolute zero?", back: "The entropy of a system approaches a constant minimum value as the temperature approaches absolute zero ($0 \\text{ K}$)", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3638", front: "What is the process where a heavy nucleus splits into two or more lighter nuclei?", back: "Nuclear Fission", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3639", front: "What is the term for the amount of work done per unit of time?", back: "Power", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3640", front: "What is the unit of measure for loudness of sound?", back: "Decibel (dB)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3641", front: "What effect describes the emission of electrons when electromagnetic radiation (light) hits a material?", back: "Photoelectric Effect", subject: "Quantum Physics" },
    { id: "3642", front: "What is the term for a material that does not allow electric current to flow easily?", back: "Insulator", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3643", front: "What is the main energy conversion in a hydroelectric dam?", back: "Gravitational Potential Energy $\\rightarrow$ Kinetic Energy $\\rightarrow$ Electrical Energy", subject: "Physics/Engineering" },
    { id: "3644", front: "What is the scientific term for the maximum speed of an object falling through a fluid (like air)?", back: "Terminal Velocity", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3645", front: "What is the process in which light is released by atoms as electrons drop from a higher energy state to a lower one?", back: "Emission (or Fluorescence/Phosphorescence)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3646", front: "What is the term for a closed loop through which current can flow?", back: "Circuit", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3647", front: "What type of wave requires a medium (solid, liquid, or gas) to travel?", back: "Mechanical wave (e.g., sound waves)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3648", front: "What is the SI unit of magnetic field strength?", back: "Tesla (T)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3649", front: "What law states that the induced current in a circuit flows in the direction that opposes the change in magnetic flux that produced it?", back: "Lenz's Law", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3650", front: "What is the scientific term for a machine's ratio of useful output energy to total input energy?", back: "Efficiency", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3651", front: "What is the phenomenon where a small input force creates a large output force (e.g., using a lever)?", back: "Mechanical Advantage", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3652", front: "What is the relationship between the wavelength of light and its frequency?", back: "They are inversely proportional ($c = \\lambda \\nu$)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3653", front: "What is the collective term for the fundamental forces of nature (excluding gravity in the Standard Model)?", back: "Electromagnetic, Weak Nuclear, and Strong Nuclear forces", subject: "Particle Physics" },
    { id: "3654", front: "What is the unit of dynamic viscosity in the SI system?", back: "Pascal-second ($\\text{Pa}\\cdot\\text{s}$) or $\\text{N}\\cdot\\text{s/m}^2$", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3655", front: "What is the measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a substance?", back: "Temperature", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3656", front: "What is the term for the maximum possible efficiency of a heat engine operating between two temperatures?", back: "Carnot Efficiency", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3657", front: "What is the specific type of heat required to change a substance's state (e.g., from solid to liquid) without changing its temperature?", back: "Latent Heat", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3658", front: "What does the abbreviation DC stand for in electrical engineering?", back: "Direct Current", subject: "Electronics" },
    { id: "3659", front: "What is the scientific term for the maximum displacement of an object from its equilibrium position in simple harmonic motion?", back: "Amplitude", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3660", front: "What law describes the inverse square relationship between the force of gravity and the distance between two masses?", back: "Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3661", front: "What is the core principle behind how a laser works?", back: "Stimulated Emission of Radiation", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3662", front: "What is the term for the collective, small-scale, random motions of particles in a fluid that transfer energy (heat)?", back: "Brownian motion", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3663", front: "What is the formula for the electrical power ($P$) dissipated by a resistor ($R$) with current ($I$)?", back: "$P = I^2R$ (or $P = VI$ or $P = V^2/R$)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3664", front: "What is the lowest possible energy state of an atom or particle?", back: "Ground state", subject: "Quantum Physics" },
    { id: "3665", front: "What is the term for the process in which a light wave's vibrations are confined to a single plane?", back: "Polarization", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3666", front: "What is the SI unit for the decay rate of a radioactive material?", back: "Becquerel (Bq)", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3667", front: "What type of wave is sound?", back: "Longitudinal (or Compression) wave", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3668", front: "What law states that for a fixed amount of gas at constant temperature, pressure and volume are inversely proportional?", back: "Boyle's Law", subject: "Physics/Chemistry" },
    { id: "3669", front: "What is the term for a material that exhibits zero electrical resistance below a critical temperature?", back: "Superconductor", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3670", front: "What is the process that allows a wave to pass through the boundary of an obstacle it cannot classically cross (important in nuclear decay)?", back: "Quantum Tunneling", subject: "Quantum Physics" },
    { id: "3671", front: "What is the term for the energy required to initiate a nuclear fission reaction?", back: "Activation Energy", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3672", front: "What is the ratio of the speed of light in a vacuum to the speed of light in a medium?", back: "Index of Refraction ($n$)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3673", front: "What is the main property of a wave that determines its color in the visible spectrum?", back: "Wavelength (or Frequency)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3674", front: "What is the term for the tendency of a spinning object to resist changes in its orientation?", back: "Angular Momentum (or Gyroscopic effect)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3675", front: "What is the scientific term for the study of fluid flow?", back: "Fluid Dynamics (or Hydrodynamics/Aerodynamics)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3676", front: "What type of force holds the nucleus of an atom together?", back: "Strong Nuclear Force", subject: "Particle Physics" },
    { id: "3677", front: "What is the energy stored in a capacitor called?", back: "Electrostatic Potential Energy", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3678", front: "What is the term for the minimum mass of fissionable material needed to sustain a nuclear chain reaction?", back: "Critical Mass", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3679", front: "What is the unit of luminosity (light power) in the SI system?", back: "Candela (cd)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3680", front: "What is the process where a gas or vapor turns directly into a solid, skipping the liquid phase?", back: "Deposition (or Desublimation)", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3681", front: "What law states that the current flowing through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the voltage across the two points?", back: "Ohm's Law ($V = IR$)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3682", front: "What are the six elementary particles that make up all matter (protons and neutrons)?", back: "Quarks (Up, Down, Charm, Strange, Top, Bottom)", subject: "Particle Physics" },
    { id: "3683", front: "What is the unit of radioactivity based on the number of disintegrations per second?", back: "Becquerel (Bq)", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3684", front: "What is the term for a system that can exchange both energy and matter with its surroundings?", back: "Open System", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3685", front: "What phenomenon occurs when light is scattered by particles much smaller than its wavelength (e.g., why the sky is blue)?", back: "Rayleigh Scattering", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3686", front: "What is the term for the difference between the actual mass of a nucleus and the sum of the masses of its constituent nucleons?", back: "Mass Defect", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3687", front: "What is the name for the resistance experienced by an object moving through a fluid or gas?", back: "Drag (or Fluid Resistance)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3688", front: "What term is used to describe a system that is in thermal, mechanical, and chemical equilibrium?", back: "Thermodynamic Equilibrium", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3689", front: "What is the term for a material that is not magnetized, but can be attracted to a magnet?", back: "Ferromagnetic", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3690", front: "What is the scientific term for the study of sound and sound waves?", back: "Acoustics", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3691", front: "What is the term for the energy required to separate the nucleons (protons and neutrons) in the nucleus?", back: "Nuclear Binding Energy", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3692", front: "What is the unit of magnetic flux density (or magnetic field)?", back: "Tesla (T)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3693", front: "What is the term for a substance that slows down neutrons in a nuclear reactor to increase the probability of fission?", back: "Moderator", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3694", front: "What is the term for an idealized object that absorbs all electromagnetic radiation that falls on it?", back: "Black Body", subject: "Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3695", front: "What is the term for the phenomenon where an electric current passing through a conductor generates heat?", back: "Joule Heating (or Resistance Heating)", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3696", front: "What is the term for an interaction where two objects collide and stick together (momentum is conserved, kinetic energy is not)?", back: "Inelastic Collision", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3697", front: "What is the scientific term for the study of very low temperatures and related phenomena?", back: "Cryogenics", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3698", front: "What type of radioactive decay involves the emission of an electron?", back: "Beta ($\\beta$) decay", subject: "Nuclear Physics" },
    { id: "3699", front: "What is the term for a wave that is stationary, resulting from the superposition of two identical waves traveling in opposite directions?", back: "Standing Wave", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3700", front: "What is the scientific term for the maximum amount of solute that can be dissolved in a given amount of solvent at a specific temperature?", back: "Solubility Limit", subject: "Chemistry/Thermodynamics" },
    { id: "3701", front: "What engineering discipline focuses on the design, construction, and maintenance of physical structures and systems (e.g., roads, bridges)?", back: "Civil Engineering", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3702", front: "What is the term for the intentional, controlled breakdown of complex hydrocarbon molecules into simpler ones (e.g., in petroleum refining)?", back: "Cracking", subject: "Chemical Engineering" },
    { id: "3703", front: "What is the term for the maximum stress a material can endure before permanently deforming?", back: "Yield Strength", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3704", front: "What type of bridge uses tension and compression forces in its arches and abutments to carry load?", back: "Arch Bridge", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3705", front: "What is the purpose of the control rods in a nuclear reactor?", back: "To absorb neutrons and control the rate of fission", subject: "Nuclear Engineering" },
    { id: "3706", front: "What is the term for a computer program used by engineers to create 2D and 3D designs?", back: "CAD (Computer-Aided Design)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3707", front: "What engineering principle involves the cyclical process of design, test, analyze, and refine?", back: "Engineering Design Process (or Iterative Design)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3708", front: "What is the term for the resistance of an engine or turbine to external forces, measured in foot-pounds or Newton-meters?", back: "Torque", subject: "Mechanical Engineering" },
    { id: "3709", front: "What is the material property that describes its ability to absorb energy and plastically deform without fracturing?", back: "Toughness", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3710", front: "What type of steel is resistant to corrosion and is often used in medical equipment and cutlery?", back: "Stainless Steel", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3711", front: "What is the scientific field concerned with the study of motion and its causes (force, energy)?", back: "Dynamics (a branch of Mechanics)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3712", front: "What is the name for the basic building block of a digital circuit that performs a logical operation (e.g., AND, OR, NOT)?", back: "Logic Gate", subject: "Electrical Engineering" },
    { id: "3713", front: "What is the term for the minimum temperature at which a liquid fuel produces enough vapor to ignite (but not sustain) a flame?", back: "Flash Point", subject: "Chemical Engineering" },
    { id: "3714", front: "What is the engineering term for the application of forces to change the speed or direction of a body (often in aerospace)?", back: "Thrust", subject: "Aerospace Engineering" },
    { id: "3705", front: "What type of corrosion protection involves connecting a more reactive metal to the object being protected?", back: "Sacrificial Anode (or Cathodic Protection)", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3716", front: "What is the term for the measure of a material's ability to resist indentation or scratching?", back: "Hardness", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3717", front: "What is the primary function of a heat exchanger in an industrial process?", back: "To efficiently transfer heat between two or more fluids", subject: "Chemical Engineering" },
    { id: "3718", front: "What is the term for a structure built across a river or stream to hold back water and create a reservoir?", back: "Dam", subject: "Civil Engineering" },
    { id: "3719", front: "What is the branch of engineering dealing with the behavior of materials and structures under stress and strain?", back: "Structural Engineering", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3720", front: "What is the difference between a stress and a strain in material science?", back: "Stress is force per unit area; Strain is the relative deformation or change in shape", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3721", front: "What is the primary function of a rectifier in an electronic circuit?", back: "To convert Alternating Current (AC) to Direct Current (DC)", subject: "Electronics" },
    { id: "3722", front: "What is the term for the automated control of machinery by electronic devices?", back: "Automation (or Cybernetics)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3723", front: "What is the measure of the ease with which a fluid flows?", back: "Viscosity", subject: "Chemical Engineering" },
    { id: "3724", front: "What type of engine uses a continuous combustion process and is commonly found in jet aircraft?", back: "Gas Turbine Engine (or Jet Engine)", subject: "Mechanical Engineering" },
    { id: "3725", front: "What is the ratio of an object's speed to the speed of sound?", back: "Mach number", subject: "Aerospace Engineering" },
    { id: "3726", front: "What common construction material is a mixture of aggregate, water, and cement?", back: "Concrete", subject: "Civil Engineering" },
    { id: "3727", front: "What is the term for the loss of mechanical energy in a fluid due to internal friction and turbulence?", back: "Head Loss", subject: "Mechanical Engineering" },
    { id: "3728", front: "What type of power generation uses the movement of tides or waves to turn a turbine?", back: "Hydrokinetic energy (or Tidal power/Wave power)", subject: "Environmental Engineering" },
    { id: "3729", front: "What is the process of coating a metal object with a thin layer of zinc to prevent rust?", back: "Galvanization", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3730", front: "What is the primary function of a pump in a fluid system?", back: "To add energy to the fluid (increase its pressure/head)", subject: "Mechanical Engineering" },
    { id: "3731", front: "What is the field of engineering focused on designing and manufacturing products to be easily and economically made?", back: "Design for Manufacturing (DFM)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3732", front: "What is the term for a material that can be stretched or compressed significantly and return to its original shape?", back: "Elastomer (or Elastic material)", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3733", front: "What is the primary purpose of a transformer in an electrical grid?", back: "To change (step up or step down) the AC voltage and current", subject: "Electrical Engineering" },
    { id: "3734", front: "What is the term for the maximum stress a material can withstand before fracture or breaking?", back: "Ultimate Tensile Strength (UTS)", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3735", front: "What is the process of connecting multiple computing devices to share resources and information?", back: "Networking (or Network Engineering)", subject: "Computer Engineering" },
    { id: "3736", front: "What component in a four-stroke internal combustion engine converts the reciprocating (up and down) motion into rotational motion?", back: "Crankshaft", subject: "Mechanical Engineering" },
    { id: "3737", front: "What is the term for the difference between the planned performance of a system and its actual performance?", back: "Tolerance (or Deviation/Error)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3738", front: "What engineering principle is used to distribute the load of a building or bridge to the ground?", back: "Foundation Engineering (a branch of Civil Engineering)", subject: "Civil Engineering" },
    { id: "3739", front: "What is the term for the degradation of materials due to environmental exposure, often caused by oxidation?", back: "Corrosion", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3740", front: "What is the scientific field of creating chemical products through large-scale industrial processes?", back: "Chemical Engineering", subject: "Chemical Engineering" },
    { id: "3741", front: "What is the ratio of output power to input power in a mechanical or electrical system?", back: "Efficiency", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3742", front: "What is the term for the process of using sound waves to inspect materials for flaws without causing damage?", back: "Ultrasonic Testing (Non-Destructive Testing)", subject: "Materials Science" },
    { id: "3743", front: "What is the primary function of a turbine?", back: "To extract energy from a moving fluid (air, water, steam) and convert it into rotational energy", subject: "Mechanical Engineering" },
    { id: "3744", front: "What type of manufacturing process builds a 3D object layer by layer, based on a digital model?", back: "Additive Manufacturing (or 3D Printing)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3745", front: "What is the term for a system where the output is monitored and fed back to adjust the input (e.g., a thermostat)?", back: "Closed-loop control system (or Feedback control)", subject: "Control Systems" },
    { id: "3746", front: "What is the key principle that allows an airplane wing (airfoil) to generate lift?", back: "Bernoulli's Principle (or pressure differential)", subject: "Aerospace Engineering" },
    { id: "3747", front: "What is the term for the maximum weight-bearing capacity of a structure or component?", back: "Load Capacity (or Maximum Load)", subject: "Structural Engineering" },
    { id: "3748", front: "What is the process of generating electricity by moving a conductor through a magnetic field?", back: "Electromagnetic Induction", subject: "Electrical Engineering" },
    { id: "3749", front: "What engineering concept involves designing products and systems to be easily understood and used by humans?", back: "Human Factors Engineering (or Ergonomics)", subject: "Engineering" },
    { id: "3750", front: "What is the primary method used to separate liquid mixtures with different boiling points in chemical industry?", back: "Distillation (or Fractional Distillation)", subject: "Chemical Engineering" },
    { id: "3751", front: "What is the scientific term for the total range of electromagnetic waves, from radio waves to gamma rays?", back: "Electromagnetic Spectrum", subject: "Physics" },
    { id: "3752", front: "What is the term for the resistance of a body of water or air to an object passing through it?", back: "Drag (or Fluid Resistance)", subject: "Mechanical Engineering" },
    { id: "3753", front: "What is the difference between a microprocessor and a microcontroller?", back: "Microprocessor is the CPU; Microcontroller is a small computer with CPU, memory, and I/O on a single chip", subject: "Computer Engineering" },
    { id: "3754", front: "What is the engineering term for a component whose primary purpose is to resist tension (stretching)?", back: "Tie Rod (or Tension member)", subject: "Structural Engineering" },
